channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: At Silverstone, James Constantinou test drives a high-performance motorbike on sale for £35,000. Designer handbag expert Claudia Valentin meets `human Ken doll' Rodrigo Alves who is selling his designer luggage and watches so that he can learn to drive. Plus, memorabilia expert Lawrence Pickett appraises a guitar owned by Alvin Stardust's widow signed by members of the Beatles and the Rolling Stones.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan Hatfield and Ellie Beardmore look at a dazzling diamond-encrusted mobile phone, a rare German clock, a stunning diamond cluster ring and a solid silver Rococo-style bowl. At Nikolas Patrick in London, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick Devine consider deals on Harry Potter's broomstick and an impressive collection of Manchester United memorabilia.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit past house-hunters, beginning with globe-trotting Matt Rushworth, who was looking forward to settling down near his family in Windsor, Berkshire. They then catch up with Sheffield couple Justin and Deborah, who were seeking a bigger home, but had very different opinions on how to tackle the property to make room for their sports gear.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with Paul and his American bride Alissa, who were looking for a property in Windsor, Berkshire, and revisit Malcolm and Jenny in Wiltshire who wanted a welcoming and cosy atmosphere for their prospective home.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Kirsty Duffy and David Bull advise Rachel and Charman, who are seeking a fresh start and willing to invest £320,000 on a home somewhere in Devon.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the owners of Hotel Commodore, Halebarns House, Ware Hall and the Ardingly Inn meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. There are tears, tantrums and bitter rebukes as the payments are revealed before the winner is finally announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Water-feature builder Geoff Carter holds the first dinner party of the week in Warrington, Cheshire, and opts for an Asian-themed menu. His guests are science teacher Emma Hoyle, call centre manager Stephen Robinson, beef farmer Alison Davies and Greek teacher Linda Weaver - who upstages the host by trying to fool the other diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Call centre manager Stephen Robinson hosts the second night in Warrington, Cheshire, as guests are asked to dress appropriately for his pink and black theme. After a mishap with the main course, Stephen hopes his choral entertainment and raspberry Bakewell slice will be able to rescue the evening and put him in the running for the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beef farmer Alison Davies serves her guests Dyffd, one of her own Hereford cows, as part of her menu for the third dinner party in Warrington, Cheshire. She shows her fellow competitors round her property, but Linda Weaver has an accident in the duck pond.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Science teacher Emma Hoyle hosts the fourth dinner party in Warrington. Both the pili pili prawn starter and the chicken main course prove a success with the other contestants, and a soak in Emma's hot tub at the end of the meal seems to round off the evening perfectly.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Linda Weaver hosts the final night of the culinary competition in Warrington, Cheshire, inviting her fellow diners to a fancy-dress party with a multicultural theme. In a bid to win the £1,000 prize, she also tries to impress her guests with her bagpipe-playing skills, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits the Beachfront Inn and Inlet, a Caribbean-style resort hotel in Fort Pierce, Florida. Young and inexperienced owner Brian is making guests' time at the hotel miserable with dusty rooms, late-night concerts and poor service. Can Gordon prevent the business from going under?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef pulls no punches as he comes to the aid of failing American restaurants.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who were expecting babies when they first met him. In 2009, Rik and Helen Francis wanted to change their city-centre living in Manchester for a move to a family home in Hale and Altrincham. In 2004, Alison and Phil Clarke were hoping to move from Bolton to Herefordshire to be nearer their relatives.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of pioneering veterinary practice Fitzpatrick Referrals in Surrey, where orthopaedic-neuro veterinary surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick and his team help some of the nation's hardest-to-cure pets using cutting-edge procedures. A man travels through the night to bring his much-loved doberman down from Cumbria to see Noel Fitzpatrick about a diseased spinal cord. Can the professor and his staff bring the canine back to health? Other cases this week are a cocker spaniel rushed in after being hit by a car and a rabbit that needs surgery for a broken ankle.(n)

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.desc: Documentary about Thames Valley Police's investigation into the disappearance of 31-year-old mother of three Natalie Hemming on May 1, 2016. The programme has extraordinary access to the officers as they try to work out whether Natalie is alive or dead, and to her family and friends, struggling with the situation unfolding around them, before an arrest is made and the case reaches its heartbreaking conclusion.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay's next stop is Philadelphia, where family-run restaurant Chiarella's is struggling to survive in an area full of thriving Italian eateries. Tommy and Dina Defino's marriage is on the verge of collapse and his sense of personal failure only adds to the troubles of their crisis-ridden business.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring The Spy Who Loved Me, Andrew Neil with Jeremy Corbyn, the SNP's Manifesto, Paul Hollywood's Continental Road Trip, the Green Party and SNP's Party Election Broadcasts, Your Face or Mine, Great British Skinny Dip and the News.(n)

programme.title: Arnie's Greatest Ever Stunts
programme.desc: Actor and former Governor of California Arnold Schwarzenegger presents a countdown of the most spectacular stunts ever committed to film. The Terminator star famously insisted on performing many of his own stunts during his Hollywood action-man heyday, and here, he highlights the achievements of fellow stars whose efforts produced thrilling set-pieces on-screen. However, Arnie does not limit himself to high-octane antics from the silver screen. He also showcases stand-alone feats, such as Jean Claude Van Damme's daring splits manoeuvre between two moving trucks, and Felix Baumgartner's free fall to Earth from the stratosphere. Includes commentary from fans, comedians, stunt coordinators and the daredevils themselves.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with David Mitchell and Cariad Lloyd, taking on Jon Richardson and Russell Howard. Sam Simmons joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: Another look at some of the globe's most bizarre climatic conditions and the science behind them, including a vast cave system with its own weather, a desert in Brazil where people swim in lagoons while surrounded by huge sand dunes, and a lake in Argentina with water than can look like concrete. Plus, glow-in-the-dark waves in the Californian city of San Diego, a Canadian family who filmed an upside-down rainbow, a 50-year puzzle of mysterious lights in the Michigan sky, and `spider lightning' in Texas.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Ladies' man Luke, 30, is ready to give up playing the field and is searching for the one. His date is 29-year-old PR manager Sophie. Tired of turning up to weddings alone, she's looking for a man to become her 'plus-one' in life. The restaurant also welcomes Bristolian mother of three Mandy, whose date is 52-year-old landscape gardener Andrew.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Former How Clean is Your House? presenter Kim Woodburn and her husband Pete decide they would like to take ownership of a holiday home on the glamourous Costa Del Sol, so Jonnie Irwin takes them to view five penthouses that meet their £200,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Alex and Jacqui MacPherson, from Eastbourne, East Sussex, plan to head to warmer climes to enjoy their retirement. They're looking for a home in the Tampa area of Florida where they can spend the winter months, so Ben Hillman shows them five properties for their budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps a couple from a West Yorkshire village with a love of travelling to find a perfect retirement home on the south coast of Barbados, on a budget of £275,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman sets out to find full-time academic Rosie from Ascot, Berkshire a property with rental potential on the Croatian island of Hvar for £80,000.(n)

programme.title: Big House, Little House
programme.desc: Aidan Keane meets a couple in Croydon planning a double-storey extension worth £190,000, and another duo in East Kilbride, who are using £50,000 to extend their living space.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: The experts help a couple looking for a property in Essex, with Kirsty Duffy showcasing the countryside and David Bull keen to show them the benefits of living by the coast.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Amanda and Clive want to leave Bromley for West Sussex with their dog Lulu, so Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help them spend their £1.25million budget wisely.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Brooklyn, New York, to tackle a 55-year-old family business. Owner John Esposito left school at the age of 14 and has worked at his parents' restaurant, Sal's Pizzeria, ever since. Their success meant they could afford to purchase the location next door in the 1990s, naming it Mama Maria after John's mother, who died in 2002. But when he lost his father as well, John became overwhelmed by the responsibility of running both establishments and his livelihood is at risk.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Loudonville, Ohio, to rescue Landoll's Mohican Castle, a custom-built, multimillion-dollar hotel set in an 1100-acre woodland estate. Co-owner Marta is struggling, having been left with the entire burden of running such a large establishment alone. Can Gordon persuade her son Jimmy to finally take the reins and turn this business around before the family legacy is destroyed?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to Charlie's Italian bistro in La Verne, southern California, where the owner's lack of business nous is putting her relatives' homes at risk, after her mother and sister put them up as collateral. To make matters worse, the restaurant's food is less than appetising and its long-serving chef seems to be incompetent.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel tries to fix a cocker spaniel's leg problems by fitting two bionic back feet, before launching a series of investigations into what is causing a cat to drag its leg. Plus, a Westie puppy with a fractured knee arrives, but it cannot keep still.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring The Spy Who Loved Me, Andrew Neil with Jeremy Corbyn, the SNP's Manifesto, Paul Hollywood's Continental Road Trip, the Green Party and SNP's Party Election Broadcasts, Your Face or Mine, Great British Skinny Dip and the News.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan: Back in the Game
programme.desc: An evening of comedy, recorded as part of the comic's 2013 sell-out Back in the Game tour, which saw Micky play to more than 500,000 people across the UK and Ireland. Performing here to his home crowd at London's Hackney Empire, the stand-up star regales his audience with tales of middle age, marriage and a man's prerogative.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Kitty hires Leo and his cousin to redecorate the basement, Fez takes up ballet to improve his love life, and Donna and Eric have an argument. Comedy, starring Wilmer Valderrama and Debra Jo Rupp.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Abby introduces her own mother and shares some surprising tales of their amazing bond and history. US reality series about the world of competitive dance.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.sub-title: Tell All Part One: Reunion Special.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jeff Collins sits down with Abby and the moms to revisit recent events. After a wild and explosive season, Christi and Kelly dish on how their friendship was tested, and tensions are high enough for one of the ladies to leave the stage. The cast answers audience questions, and the girls perform some of their best dance routines.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Part one of three. Bridget finds herself attracted to someone unexpected as Valentine's Day approaches, and Jim sends CJ on an errand to Canada.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Part two of three. Bridget tries to start a relationship with new tutor Jeremy, while Jim clears out the basement to create some space of his own - only to have to share it with a homeless CJ. Starring David Spade and James Garner.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jay and Michael return from a night out to find Junior and his new girlfriend Vanessa in a compromising position. American sitcom, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part two of two. After catching Junior and his girlfriend Vanessa getting up to no good, Michael and Jay throw him out of the house, and he ends up living in a tent in the back garden until everything has calmed down.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Lorelai breaks up with Richard over his betrayal of Jason, who in turn considers legal action. Rory suspects her English professor is giving her preferential treatment because of his relationship with Paris, and the band's first gig proves a huge success. Lane discovers her mother has taken in a lodger - and is appalled to find the new arrival wearing clothes belonging to her. Guest starring Michael York.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: The annual Abby Lee Dance Company recital is staged. When the only new solo for the recital goes to Paige , Kelly goes ballistic and threatens to pull both of her daughters. Meanwhile, all the girls compete in a high-fashion photo shoot to appear on the cover of a major magazine.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Paul and Steve's first job is an eviction with a twist when they find out the landlord is the tenant's mother, while their next case is also tricky and involves family members with a question mark over their immigration status who are now facing homelessness. Their final case involves a man with a history of mental illness who has reached the end of his tenancy but refuses to leave, and Steve tries to find a solution after a church minister and his mother fail to placate him.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie's fears escalate after receiving a disturbing letter from Sonya, Aaron suffers a crisis of confidence, and Ben investigates to see how trustworthy Finn really is.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo introduces James to everyone at Olivia's birthday party, but it transpires later that he took the shot of John that accompanied a disparaging feature in the day's Coastal News.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: There is uproar among the mothers when Abby choreographs a flashy routine that involves guns as props. Meanwhile, Christi and Kelly set out to expose a secret about Jill.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.sub-title: The Kyles Go to Hawaii - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of three. Michael and Jay go out for a romantic dinner, but both find it hard to resist temptation from members of the opposite sex. Meanwhile, Junior dates a local girl.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.sub-title: The Kyles Go to Hawaii - Part Three.

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.desc: Abby leaves for Los Angeles, and asks Holly, Kelly and Jill to spy on arch rivals the Candy Apples. Meanwhile, Cathy recruits members for a new team.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Puppies Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos featuring animals doing bizarre and humorous things. Clips include overexcited pups, pilfering pups, pups that fall asleep in their dinner bowls, puppy vloggers, driving pups, and even a look at the latest craze - pups who go into a quivering frenzy at the sight of doorstoppers. Narrator Iain Lee is joined by comedians Dave Spikey, Matt Richardson and Zoe Lyons.(n)

programme.title: Red Dawn
programme.desc: The North Korean military mounts an invasion of the United States, with a small Washington state town the first target for their attack. The local teenagers form a resistance movement and carry out a guerrilla campaign to drive out the occupying forces. Remake of the 1980s action adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth and Jeffrey Dean Morgan.(n)

Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Cheryl Hines, Jeff Daniels and Will Arnett.(n)

programme.title: What Happens in Vegas
programme.desc: Two strangers accidentally booked into the same hotel room in Las Vegas spend a night on the town together. After a wild and drunken time in the casinos, they wake up to find they are now a married couple, and later win $3million which they both have a claim to - leading to a battle of wits over who keeps the money. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz and Ashton Kutcher.(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A mother and her daughter retreat to what they believe is a secure sanctuary during a brutal home invasion. Newly divorced Meg Altman (Jodie Foster) and her young daughter Sarah (Kristen Stewart) move into a New York brownstone equipped with a panic room; a hidden chamber built as a sanctuary in the event of unwanted "visitors," unaware of how soon they will need it. When their home is the target of a seamless late-night break-in, Meg and Sarah take a stand from the sanctuary of the panic room, playing a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with three intruders: Burnham (Forest Whitaker), Raoul (Dwight Yoakam) and Junior (Jared Leto), during a brutal home invasion(n)

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: Emotional docudrama about terminally ill New Jersey police officer Laurel Hester, whose 2005 legal battle for the right to pass her pension benefits on to her female life partner became an equal-rights milestone(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must re-evaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Hilary Swank adds another outstanding characterization to her Oscar-winning résumé. She plays Holly Kennedy, a young widow whose late husband (Gerard Butler) arranged to have 10 letters delivered posthumously to encourage her to carry on with her life. Directed by Richard LaGravenese, who cowrote the moving script with Steven Rogers. The film is an adaptation of Cecelia Ahern's popular first novel, which she wrote when she was 21(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: Val Kilmer, who dazzled as Jim Morrison in "The Doors" and Doc Holliday in "Tombstone," adds another outstanding real-life characterization to his résumé---John Holmes. This film chronicles the porn star's suspected involvement in a 1981 homicide that left four of his 'friends' dead. The first-rate supporting cast includes Lisa Kudrow, Eric Bogosian, Dylan McDermott and Ted Levine(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Director Clint Eastwood draws on his experience to put together a western with winning components: the bad guys are corporate jerks out for a profit at the expense of Mother Nature, the good guys are poor but independent gold miners threatened by the corporation, the hero Preacher (Eastwood) is there to set things right, and he is beyond any of that romance stuff. Preacher's shady past is implied when he first comes into town and keeps his anonymity intact. He is sheltered by an unmarried duo, Hull and Sarah (Michael Moriarty and Carrie Snodgress), and soon pays them back by saving Hull from a few murderous thugs. Caught in the middle of the growing conflict, Preacher rallies the miners into a combative group and then goes on to final showdown in true "high noon" style(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: A cornet player at a legendary 1920s-era Harlem nightspot gets caught in the orbit of a notorious gangster and his teenaged mistress(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: NaÏve Texan Joe Buck drifts to New York and, with the help of local wheeler-dealer Enrico 'Ratso' Rizzo, tries to make a living as a gigolo. Drama(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: Antonio Banderas, Rodrigo Santoro, and Martin Sheen star in this ensemble drama detailing the daring real-life rescue of 33 Chilean miners who were trapped in the San Jose Mine for 69 days in 2010. Patricia Riggen directs from a script by Jose Rivera and Mikko Alanne(n)

programme.title: Just Cause
programme.desc: Mystery thriller in which a Harvard law professor reluctantly gets drawn into the case of a young black man on death row in Florida for the rape and murder of a girl. The lawyer uncovers disturbing facts about the conduct of the police in the case, but just when he seems to have enough evidence to ensure the condemned man's release, events take an unexpected twist(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: A paralysed forensics expert teams up with a fresh-faced cop to hunt down a serial killer. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Director: Don Siegel. When a mad man calling himself 'the Scorpio Killer' menaces the city, tough as nails San Francisco Police Inspector Harry Callahan is assigned to track down and ferret out the crazed psychopath(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: The Office star Rainn Wilson portrays a drummer named "Fish," who gets a second shot at fame 20 years after getting kicked out of his band on the very night they signed the record contract that made them stars. Fish has spent the past two decades languishing at soul-crushing day jobs while his old bandmates became legends, continuing to grace magazine covers and dominate the radio. He might just get another chance at musical success, however, when his teenage cousin invites him to drum for his high school garage band, and they end up catching the ear of record executives. Now, Fish is determined to live the hedonistic rock & roll lifestyle he missed out on 20 years ago, but his new bandmates don't appreciate his hard partying -- and neither do his middle-aged knees. This Fox Atomic comedy co-stars Christina Applegate. Shawn Levy (Night at the Museum) and Tom McNulty co-produced the feature, which was penned by Wallace Wolodarsky and Maya Forbes, and directed by Peter Cattaneo (Opal Dream)(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: The Johnsons set out from California for a family reunion in Missouri. The parents are split up, the kids are arguing - can everyone keep it together for the big day?(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A mysterious man saves a pregnant woman from a gunman and helps to deliver her baby. However, when the relentless gang kill the mother and continue to pursue the newborn, he resolves to protect the child and find out why he is being targeted(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss, Dan Hedaya and Seymour Cassel star in this comedy about mobsters who come out of retirement for one last job. Facing eviction from the hotel where they live, the guys try to scare off the owners with a staged shooting. But the plan backfires, and a hilarious comedy of errors begins. Carrie-Anne Moss, Jennifer Tilly(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Jacob and Will Grimm are a sibling pair of con artists specialising in taking advantage of peasant superstitions about witches and curses. But when they are called upon to investigate the disappearance of a number of girls from what is said to be an enchanted forest, they suddenly find themselves at the centre of what might just be a very dark, and very real, fairy tale(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: A woman on the lam with her young daughter takes drastic steps when her abusive husband tracks them down(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a group of extreme athletes who are using their specialized skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. Remake of the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

However, they find a population being terrorised by Saddam Hussein's forces and desperate for help, and soon realise some things are more important than riches(n)

Crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion, Stana Katic and Seamus Dever.(n)

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a violinist with the New York Symphony Orchestra and find the trail leads back to her Svengali-like conductor. However, they have a difficult job getting the case to trial, with a reluctant witness, a suspicious judge and a talented lawyer standing between them and a guilty verdict.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A gang leader is stabbed to death in a prison scuffle, and Briscoe and Green uncover a number of suspects as it becomes clear the victim had numerous enemies on both sides of the law. The investigation results in a charge, but McCoy faces an uphill battle to convict the accused. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac, Hawkes and Lindsay investigate the death of a woman found on a subway train and discover that although her hands and face are covered in blood, she has no obvious injuries. Meanwhile, Danny and Stella visit the home of a playboy bachelor who drowned in his indoor pool - and are surprised to learn he has a wedding-cake decoration lodged in his lung. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a navy intelligence commander responsible for tracking the movements of a Venezuelan politician disappears. programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The author investigates when a Father Christmas impersonator dies, apparently while flying over Central Park. The man is found to have been shot and identified as a former business shark, who had become a reformed character helping local residents fight against eviction. Meanwhile, Castle and Beckett prepare for their first holiday season together.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The Machine has a special mission for Root and Shaw as part of a two-pronged offensive against an organisation that it has identified as a danger, while Finch sends Reese to go and find Shaw when he is unable to contact her. Finch then sets to work on the latest number issued by the computer, which belongs to New York public administrator employee Timothy Sloan, who has been investigating the death of his foster brother from a supposed heroin overdose. Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a gay man beaten to death during the abduction of his adopted infant son. At first they suspect the victim's wealthy partner may be complicit in the crime - until information about the child's birth mother and homophobic biological father prompts them to pursue a different line of inquiry.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A pregnant loan officer is found murdered in the boot of her car and the trail leads to drugs and a professional basketball player, whose ties to the victim appear to extend beyond the financial deal she approved for him. Detective drama, with Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Hawkes is accused of killing someone in a bar-room brawl, and seemingly irrefutable evidence is produced against him. Mac and the team are taken off the case, but refuse to accept he is guilty and ponder whether anyone has a motive to frame him. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny answer a call reporting a body found in a peep-show booth. Gary Sinister and Hill Harper star.(n)

programme.desc: Hetty confronts Alexa Comescu and tells her Callen is dead, but the crime boss knows she is lying. Real-time episode of the crime drama, starring Linda Hunt, Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The CEO of a software company linked to a cyber-attack against the Department of Defence is kidnapped, and Kensi and Deeks go undercover to protect the man's family after fears over their safety. Meanwhile, Callen continues to research his past.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Public works employee Luis Valdez is found stabbed to death in a ditch by the side of a road. He had recently visited the locations of several unsolved murders, so a theory is proposed that Valdez was on to the killer and was murdered to keep him quiet. To build a case, the team re-examines the evidence of the cold cases, using modern techniques, but this prompts the serial killer involved to come out of retirement. Crime drama, starring Corey Stoll and Alfred Molina.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a six-year-old boy who is believed to have collapsed during an exorcism at a late-night church service. However, forensics reveal the victim was smothered before the rite took place, casting suspicion on his foster parents and social worker. Starring Christopher Meloni, Ice-T and Richard Belzer.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The police discover a 12-year-old boy posted sinister threats to a girl in an internet chatroom and suspect his anger stems from sexual abuse. programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: CSI: NY

Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.desc: A fisherman reels in two dead bodies at a remote creek, and Walt has to work with an officer from the reservation police and a national forest ranger. programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Lazy-Hazy-Crazy Days. Summer isn't the only thing that's over and done with as Gilmore Girls begins its third season. Chances are that Lorelai (Lauren Graham) will never be able to marry Christopher (David Sutcliffe), the father of her teenage daughter Rory (Alexis Bledel); Christopher must now devote his time to his "ex" Sherry, who is pregnant with his child. As for Rory, she has returned from her brief sojourn to Washington, D.C., to begin her final year at Chilton prep school -- and to make what she thinks will be her final decision concerning the two men in her life, Dean (Jared Padalecki) and Jess (Milo Ventimiglia). Elsewhere in Stars Hollow, Lorelai's scatterbrained friend Sookie (Melissa McCarthy) settles into domesticity with new hubby Jackson (Jackson Douglas); and the crotchety Taylor tries to orchestrate the town's first annual End-of-Summer Madness Festival, despite being laid up with a broken leg. Senator Barbara Boxer puts in a cameo appearance in a scene where she matches wits with the estimable Paris Geller (Liza Weil)(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls

The setting is Verona, Italy -- the city where Romeo and Juliet first met. In Verona, there's a wall where the lovelorn leave notes, hoping that Juliet will answer their inquiries about love. Sophie (Seyfried) is part of a team of volunteers who respond to the letters. programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. Along the way, Billy's crew gains three new recruits: Arkansas Dave Rudabaugh (Christian Slater), Tom O'Folliard (Balthazar Getty), and Hendry French (Alan Ruck). Though the film suffers from an uneven script, many performances -- particularly Slater's -- are surprisingly strong, and the movie looks great. Kimble had the perfect life - a beautiful wife, medical career, an expensive townhouse - a perfect life until the night his wife was murdered, died in his arms and he was convicted of the crime. programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Endlessly imitated, The Terminator made the reputation of cowriter/director James Cameron -- who would go on to make 1997's titanic Titanic -- and solidified the stardom of Arnold Schwarzenegger. The movie begins in a post-apocalyptic 2029, when Los Angeles has been largely reduced to rubble and is under the thumb of all-powerful ruling machines. Kyle Reese (Michael Biehn), a member of the human resistance movement, is teleported back to 1984. His purpose: to rescue Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton), the mother of the man who will lead the 21st-century rebels against the tyrannical machines, from being assassinated before she can give birth. Likewise thrust back to 1984 is The Terminator (Schwarzenegger), a grim, well-armed, virtually indestructable cyborg who has been programmed to eliminate Sarah Connor. After killing two "Sarah Connors" who turn out to be the wrong women, he finally aims his gunsights at the genuine article. This is the film in which Schwarzenegger declared "I'll be baaaack" -- and back he was, in "kinder and gentler" form, in the even more successful Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991)(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: In debt to a gangster, petty criminal Gerard Butler pulls off a heist that has repercussions in the underworld. Guy Ritchie caper. Strong language/violence/mature themes. (2008)(110 mins)(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Office worker Wesley learns not only that his dad was a lethal hitman, but also that he's inherited the same skills(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: The true story of one of America's most violent and infamous gangsters, Whitey Bulger. Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror about a half-human, half-alien female mutant who escapes from a government laboratory and attempts to prolong the life of her species by mating with a human. Pursued by scientists and police, she passes through a chrysalid stage and takes on the appearance of a beautiful young woman. But she can also metamorphose from her eye-catching form into a repulsive, death-dealing monster(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In Washington, D.C., in the year 2054, murder has been eliminated. The future is seen and the guilty punished before the crime has ever been committed. From a nexus deep within the Justice Department's elite Precrime Unit, all the evidence to convict - from imagery alluding to the time, place and other details - is seen by Pre-Cogs, three psychic beings whose visions of murder have never been wrong. It is the nation's most advanced crime force, a perfect system. And no-one works harder for Precrime than its top man, Chief John Anderton. Destroyed by a tragic loss, Anderton has thrown all of his passion into a system that could potentially spare thousands of people from the tragedy he lived through. Six years later, the coming vote to take it national has only fuelled his conviction that Precrime works. Anderton has no reason to doubt it... until he becomes its #1 suspect(n)

programme.title: Ricochet
programme.desc: A cop receives lots of media attention when he nabs an infamous, sadistic killer at an amusement park. The murderer stews in jail for seven years, obsessively following the rising career of his arresting officer, who becomes a DA with a promising future, a husband, and a dad. This doesn't sit well with the vengeful convict, who after escaping from prison, puts into play a series of fiendish plots in an attempt to destroy the attorney's marriage and career..(n)

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: Brutal bloodbath with WWE superstar Kane. A group of delinquents are sent to clean a dilapidated hotel unaware that a reclusive psychopath has made it his home. Can they survive his wrath?(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Big-budget action fantasy about the battle for survival in a world where dry land has disappeared with the melting of the polar ice caps. One man, who has become amphibious, tries to protect survivors on an artificial atoll made from scrap metal by taking on a gang of marauding pirates. He is also intent on discovering if there is any truth in the myth that there is still some land left above water(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: After a disastrous summer, Harry returns to begin his fifth year at Hogwarts, one of the toughest he will ever have. A few group of students and parents believe him or Dumbledore that Voldemort is really back, and a never-ending series of articles states that they are insane. On top of that, Dolores Umbridge, the new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher, proves to be the nastiest person Harry has ever encountered(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: Doomsday comes to LA in this gripping tale of terror, panic and paranoia. When dirty bombs are detonated over Southern California, a husband (Rory Cochrane) and his wife (Mary McCormack) become quarantined, he inside their house, she outside. As contaminated ash rains down from the sky, chaos reigns across the area as those left out in the open run the risk of being poisoned by the fatal toxins. The film is the directorial debut of production designer Chris Gorak, who also wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: In northern Australia at the beginning of World War II, an English aristocrat inherits a cattle station the size of Maryland. When English cattle barons plot to take her land, she reluctantly joins forces with a rough-hewn stock-man to drive 2,000 head of cattle across hundreds of miles of the country's most unforgiving land, only to still face the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by the Japanese forces that had attacked Pearl Harbor only months earlier(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: Darry and Trish spend the long hours of their road trip bickering and scoring points off each other. There doesn't seem to be anyone else on their remote country road, until a maniacal driver scares them witless. Old-fashioned terror with some great suspense(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding installment in the dystopian young-adult series, Thomas and the other Gladers journey across an obstacle-filled wasteland called the Scorch. Along the way, they search for information regarding the organization known as WCKD(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: Naomi Watts shines in this thriller about a reporter who investigates her niece's mysterious death, which seems to be linked to a videotape. Apparently, anyone who watches the tape dies horribly seven days later. Martin Henderson, David Dorfman, Brian Cox, Jane Alexander, Lindsay Frost, Amber Tamblyn(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the nerve-shredding third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, an ex-cop who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: In a grim near future, weighed down by economic chaos and high unemployment, criminals on death row race armoured cars for the entertainment of the public. The death rate is high, but the winner can earn his freedom. One such con is persuaded to race in the masked guise of a popular champion, but he begins to worry that an anonymous driver is unlikely to win this gladiatorial game(n)

programme.desc: Coverage from Doncaster, Lingfield Park, Newcastle, Hexham, Worcester, Navan and Tramore.(n)

programme.title: Stateside
programme.desc: Live coverage from the United States.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: Keeley Donovan observes a project using chickens to tackle loneliness and isolation in older people. Margherita Taylor discovers the healing power of flowers. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore properties in Chatham, Kent, Tylorstown in south Wales and Perry Barr, Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate the new trend for protein-enhanced versions of familiar products to see if paying the extra has any benefit.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Footage of near misses caught on CCTV, featuring a grandmother contacting emergency services while battling to stop her four-year-old grandson from choking on a grape. Plus, two men swept away by a freak wave while checking to see if a road is passable. With Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A walk in the park turns into a nightmare for Rob, while Sid reveals a dirty little secret to Emma. Elsewhere, Megan acts fast when a vulnerable patient is faced with eviction.(n)

programme.title: !mpossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which players compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a mother and son search for a property in the Hampshire countryside, and away from the hunt, he takes the controls of a vintage locomotive on the Watercress Line.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: The weekly final sees chefs Nigel Haworth, Amandine Chaignot, Paul Ainsworth and Jun Tanaka pair up with their chosen home cook partners and go head to head in the ultimate pro-am cooking competition. And to pile on the pressure, three-star Michelin chef Pierre Koffmann judges their final dishes. Culinary challenge, hosted by Sheree Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Jonty Hearnden v James Braxton Showdown.
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden takes on James Braxton for a final time in the showdown, and everything is at stake as they set out to each buy eight items at four different locations, before the auction determines who has invested the most wisely.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones, Patrick Kielty and Jason Mohammad present from Cardiff, where a huge welcoming party for thousands of football fans is in full swing as the Welsh capital prepares to host the UEFA Champions League final. Musician Cerys Matthews goes behind the scenes at the National Stadium of Wales to see how it's gearing up for the big clash between Real Madrid and Juventus, while football-obsessed comedian Elis James jets off to Madrid in an attempt to track down superstar Welsh player Gareth Bale.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the pressure builds on Jack, he gets a shock with an unexpected arrival. Mick is out to impress as the Carters prepare for a meeting with Fi, while Kim has a proposition for Denise. Patrick and Dot catch up about everything that's been happening.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a special edition from York, as Prime Minister Theresa May and Opposition Leader Jeremy Corbyn are each quizzed on their policies. The two politicians will not debate each other directly, but will instead field questions from audience members on a consecutive basis.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Tom Cruise, currently promoting new movie The Mummy, along with Annabelle Wallis who appears alongside him in the film. Hollywood heart-throb Zac Efron also takes up residency on the sofa to discuss the big-screen revival of 1990s cult TV series Baywatch. Plus, singer-songwriter Beth Ditto performs her current single Fire. Providing there's time - and there usually is - Graham will also subject more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better stand up to scrutiny.(n)

programme.title: Sliding Doors
programme.desc: A London woman's entire future hinges on whether or not she catches a train. In one version of events, she gets the chance to start afresh and lead a happy new life, but in the other she is stuck supporting her lazy, unfaithful boyfriend. Comedy drama, presenting two parallel stories featuring the same character. Starring Gwyneth Paltrow, John Hannah and John Lynch.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Jamestown and Peaky Blinders star Sophie Rundle joins Matt Tebbutt to sample culinary treats prepared by Tony Singh and Anna Hansen in the studio kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Raymond Blanc: How to Cook Well
programme.desc: The chef gives a masterclass in grilling, whether indoors on a stove or outside on a barbecue. In the vegetable garden of his restaurant, Raymond prepares a spatchcock chicken with celeriac remoulade, and seabass wrapped in banana leaves, which protect the delicate fish while allowing the smoky flavour to permeate it. For dessert, he demonstrates how to make grilled fruit brochettes with coconut rice. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Wonnacott challenges two teams to scour a Derby antiques fair for bargains with the help of experts Kate Bliss and David Harper. At the resulting auction one of the purchased items, a dog bowl, causes a stir. Plus, Tim takes a trip to the historic Hatfield House.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired lecturer search for a property in the countryside of Northumberland on a budget of £200,000. Away from the hunt, the presenter visits a castle.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore saves three items from the recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, and Daniel Heath comes up with an ingenious solution for rusty old metal props while upholstery master Anthony Devine has a rather outlandish idea to revitalise a design classic.(n)

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon
programme.desc: A clumsy Viking boy longs to become a mighty dragon slayer and protect his village from the fearsome flying lizards, but his father thinks he is not up to the task. However, when he sets out to prove his worth, he ends up befriending a dragon, and realises his people may have misjudged the creatures. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Jay Baruchel and Gerard Butler.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents the general knowledge quiz as famous faces from children's television programmes take part. This edition features CBBC presenters Anthea Turner and Andy Crane, CBeebies stars Justin Fletcher and Gemma Hunt, children's TV hosts Dave Benson-Phillips and Gareth Jones, and former presenters Sally James and Geoffrey Hayes. The famous faces try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Co-host Richard Osman has all the answers.(n)

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
programme.desc: Intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones goes in search of the legendary Ark of the Covenant, a biblical artefact of devastating power. His quest leads him to Egypt, where the Nazis are plotting to use the Ark to further Hitler's plans for world domination - aided by Jones's deceitful French rival. Steven Spielberg's action adventure, with Harrison Ford, Karen Allen, Paul Freeman and John Rhys-Davies.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The whole world has fallen under the sway of a mass delusion, and it seems only Bill Potts can see through it. Even the Doctor is unable to comprehend the truth, meaning it is up to Bill to set the record straight by persuading her friend that humanity is in deadly danger. But a Time Lord's conviction is not easily broken, and with the fate of an entire species on the line, if Bill cannot get the Doctor on-side, she may find herself forced to kill him. Sci-fi drama, with Pearl Mackie, Peter Capaldi and Matt Lucas and guest star Michelle Gomez.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Elle agrees to deliver a career talk at her son Blake's school, but her speech is derailed when she discovers some unexpected truths about her child and his friends. Luckily, Josh and Jacob are on hand to help. Medical drama, starring Jaye Griffiths.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes becomes concerned when Dermot announces he wants to ask his childhood friend Buster, a known criminal, to be his best man. However, she is distracted when her neighbour Winnie's husband is rushed to hospital, leaving her son trying to raise funds for his wedding by getting embroiled in a money-making scheme.(n)

programme.title: Clique
programme.desc: Faced with proof of the darkness at the heart of the world she and Georgia have entered, Holly faces a dilemma. Unable to turn to Rory, she instead seeks advice from a new group of friends, who conspire with her to drag the truth out into the light of day. Doing so will bring the world crashing down around those who thought themselves unassailable, but also serve as a point of no return for Holly.(n)

programme.title: Clique
programme.desc: Tensions have escalated to a fatal degree, forcing Holly to ally herself with Rachel. All the hidden secrets of Solasta and the clique now seem to have been revealed, and Holly finds herself doubting every choice she has made throughout her first term. However, as Holly seeks to bring Georgia back from the brink, there is one last truth to be revealed, one that connects to her own past. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Spectacular Now
programme.desc: A teenage loner wakes up one morning to find a classmate passed out drunk on her lawn. They form an unlikely friendship, and he offers her help in constructing a new persona for herself that will boost her confidence - but begins to fall in love with the act she is putting on. Drama based on the novel by Tim Tharp, starring Miles Teller, Shailene Woodley and Brie Larson.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British chopper pilot rushes to the aid of an elderly farmer who is fighting for his life, while two UK policemen discover a darker side to life down under.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville look at hygiene in supermarkets in other shops, finding dirty toilets, faulty fridges and food being sold past its sell-by date.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Top chef Jun Tanaka has his eye on the prize as he puts three home cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make the perfect red wine sauce.(n)

programme.title: The World According to Kids
programme.desc: The young members of a choir in Liverpool, a debating club in Bradford and a boxing club in Hackney explore what they think of adults and how they think the world would be different if children were in charge. Eleven-year-old Salim wants to ban book-makers to stop adults from gambling, 10-year-old Sahar talks about her experiences of Islamophobia while wearing her hijab, and Jade causes upset among her friends when she reveals she would save her dog from a sinking ship before any of them. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Jo Coburn appraises the latest events from the General Election campaign trail. Plus, interviews and debate.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: Yorkshireman Stephen Hills hopes to be reunited with his father Alan, having been apart since the 1984 miners' strike. Plus, the story of 81 year-old Eric Morgan, who only found out he was adopted when signing up for National Service in 1952 and may now have finally made contact with a half-sister.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: A violent assault keeps McKay from the five-a-side match, especially as the victim is a known drug dealer. Conor covers for another person's wrongdoing.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Chefs Si King and Dave Myers continue their culinary journey into the history of British food, and in this edition explore breakfast dishes, discovering how the morning meal keeps evolving.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: Jonathan Scott visits northern Tsavo to determine the extent of the rabies outbreak and the fate of the orphaned elephants, then hurries south to see Emily before she is released back into the wild. In Nairobi, Michaela Strachan reports on babies Jipe and Late, and takes part in an extraordinary football match, where the orphans compete against the keepers.(n)

programme.title: Super Giant Animals
programme.desc: Steve Backshall travels across the world to encounter the largest animals he can find and discover the remarkable things their size enables them to do. Highlights include Steve swimming with Nile crocodiles in Botswana, dodging two-ton elephant seals in California and diving with sperm whales in the Caribbean.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon embark on the final stage of their Scottish road trip, beginning in Rait, a small village in Perth and Kinross. They then travel through Dundee and Arbroath before heading to auction in Edinburgh. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Debatable
programme.desc: Writer and journalist Grace Dent, broadcaster Dan Walker and former BBC royal correspondent Jennie Bond use their knowledge and debating skills to help Pat from Sunderland win a cash prize. Hosted by Patrick Kielty. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Eggheads
programme.desc: A team comprising children's TV presenter Barney Harwood, former world champion boxer Steve Collins, actor and impressionist Lewis MacLeod, Sky News weather presenter Nazaneen Ghaffar and One Show reporter Alex Riley takes on the general knowledge champions. Presented by Jeremy Vine. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Scotland chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Gary Parsons - executive chef at Wimbledon - as the programme continues its tennis-themed series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on herbs that will grow happily in shade, and has an unusual choice for his summer containers - bananas. He also recalls a visit he made to Chatsworth House earlier in the year, where he learned about the history of its extensive grounds and gardens and heard of the challenges of putting on its first RHS flower show. Flo Headlam visits a school where gardening is high on the curriculum, while Nick Bailey reveals how a pond can be built in a weekend. Plus, the programme catches up with a head gardener who manages a garden situated on a barge. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Secret discussions and unexpected close encounters occur through the court and beyond as a weary Louis XIV is offered an opportunity to change the course of his conflict with William of Orange. However, it is a face from the King's past that brings his mental crisis to a climax. Tensions increase as mistrustful Madame de Montespan suspects her devout friend Madame Scarron also has feelings for Louis. George Blagden, George Webster, Anna Brewster and Catherine Walker star in the sumptuous period drama.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect's Victoria Coren Mitchell assumes the mantle as host, inviting veteran Sky News journalist Adam Boulton and the Rev Richard Coles to join regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton on the satirical current affairs quiz.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur in reaction to the day's events. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events as the General Election campaign enters its final week. Presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Later - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Extended edition of the music programme. Brighton duo Royal Blood return to the show with songs from their highly anticipated second album How Did We Get So Dark, while from south London, influential electro-pop trio the xx perform tracks from their chart-topping I See You LP. New Orleans, bandleader and musician Trombone Shorty presents material from his Parking Lot Symphony album, which continues his style of hard-edged funk that employs brass-band beats, rock dynamics and improvisation in a jazz tradition. Los Angeles, sisters Este, Danielle and Alana, aka Haim, play a couple of numbers from their upcoming second album Something to Tell You. Plus, debuts from one of reggae's newest stars Chronixx, and new country music performer Maren Morris. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: New Zealand v Australia. Action from the Group A match, which took place at Edgbaston in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Rio Ferdinand: Being Mum and Dad
programme.desc: The former footballer Rio Ferdinand lost his 34-year-old wife Rebecca to cancer in May 2015, and a year on he is still coming to terms with his loss, and the effect it has had upon himself and his three children. Rio meets other families coping with bereavement, and looks at what help is available for parents and children who have experienced loss to move on with their lives.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.sub-title: The Pyramid at the End of the World.
programme.desc: The Doctor, Bill and Nardole find themselves in the middle of a war-zone, as Chinese, Russian and American forces stand poised to clash. At the centre of the field of battle is a 5,000-year-old pyramid, and while there are many problems with the situation presented, the Doctor is concerned with only one - there was no pyramid there yesterday. With the three opposing forces promising mutually assured destruction, and every clock in the world counting down to Earth's ruin, an offer of help arrives in the form of a message from an alien race. To avoid annihilation, humanity must willingly become slaves for their would-be saviours. Sci-fi drama, starring Peter Capaldi, Pearl Mackie and Matt Lucas.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Heart of the British Isles - A Grand Tour.
programme.desc: The presenters take a tour of the Irish Sea, visiting every country in the British Isles. Alice Roberts receives tips for surviving quicksand in Morecambe Bay, Mark Horton observes the remains of Isambard Kingdom Brunel's final work in Liverpool, and Nicholas Crane discovers why Anglesey is the site of some of Britain's biggest earthquakes.(n)

programme.title: Never a Dull Moment
programme.desc: A songwriter living in New York falls in love with a widowed ranch owner, and hastily marries him. However, she finds adapting to country living far from her glamorous Manhattan roots proves difficult, as does winning the acceptance of her stepchildren. Romantic comedy, with Irene Dunne, Fred MacMurray and Natalie Wood.(n)

programme.title: Goodbye, Mr Chips
programme.desc: A kindly Latin teacher leads a simple life at an English boarding school, until he finds his life made happier and more complicated when he falls in love while on a walking holiday. His newfound bliss is shattered as he is forced to deal with his former pupils being killed in the First World War. Period drama based on James Hilton's novel, starring an Oscar-winning Robert Donat, with Greer Garson and Paul Henreid.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Hebridean Escape
programme.desc: The marine biologist follows the Bonnie Prince Charlie route on horseback as he writes a guide book to a series of trails around the islands. He also takes part in an anti-erosion project on Vatersay, and visits Benbecula, where he joins a hedgehog patrol, before attending the last lamb sales of the year and organising a beach clean-up.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore properties in Liverpool, Stoke and London to be auctioned, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Scotland prepare starters, with returning chefs Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath battling it out with newcomer Angela Malik for a place in the national finals. All three contenders take huge risks, with Ally making a ricotta that should take 24 hours to prepare, Michael attempting to impress with a vegan dish and Angela intriguing her fellow contestants with a savoury ice-cream dish.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ally McGrath creates an inventive fish dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed. Meanwhile, Angela Malik takes on the ancient skill of preparing sashimi, and defending regional winner Michael Bremner uses turbot for his meal, but which will impress the veteran chef?.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: An insight into the life of one of Hollywood's best-loved actresses, telling the story of her Oscar-winning career by using rarely seen archive footage of her appearances on the BBC.(n)

programme.title: Ivanhoe
programme.desc: A brave knight defies his father and enlists the help of a rich man and his daughter to rescue Richard the Lionheart from imprisonment. Along the way they also have to counter the machinations of tyrannical Prince John, who is determined their quest will fail. Medieval adventure based on Walter Scott's novel, starring Robert Taylor, Elizabeth Taylor, Joan Fontaine, George Sanders and Guy Rolfe.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Sea Otters - A Million Dollar Baby.
programme.desc: Following the life of a sea otter pup growing up on the coast of California, in an unusual location among the yachts of a marina. Its mother must teach her baby how to avoid the boats and find food in the busy harbour, but an attack by a tough male otter signals disaster for the family. Narrated by Bonnie Greer.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques at Blackpool Tower Circus, where expert James Lewis discovers terracotta tomb figures that could be more than 1,000 years old. Plus, Anita Manning examines a collection of seaside postcards, and Paul explores the Morecambe Winter Gardens - one of Lancashire's most famous theatres.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on herbs that will grow happily in shade, and has an unusual choice for his summer containers - bananas. He also recalls a visit he made to Chatsworth House earlier in the year, where he learned about the history of its extensive grounds and gardens and heard of the challenges of putting on its first RHS flower show. Flo Headlam visits a school where gardening is high on the curriculum, while Nick Bailey reveals how a pond can be built in a weekend. Plus, the programme catches up with a head gardener who manages a garden situated on a barge. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Grow Your Own
programme.desc: Town residents are outraged when a refugee family is given space on their allotments to help rehabilitate a traumatised father - but both groups unite in a common cause when a mobile phone company plans to build a mast in the area. Comedy drama, starring Benedict Wong, Philip Jackson, Omid Djalili and Olivia Colman.(n)

programme.title: The Lake District: A Wild Year
programme.desc: For the wildlife and people who live amid the stunning scenery of the Lake District, life is one of continuous change. This documentary features cutting-edge camera techniques offering a new and unique perspective on a turbulent year in the life of England's largest national park. Time-lapse photography shows months and weeks passing in seconds - snow and ice giving way to sunshine or the frequent rain showers - while the animals, plants and people find extraordinary ways to cope with the challenges of this ancient landscape. Narrated by Bernard Cribbins.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Mainwaring and his platoon are put in charge of manning an observation post on a derelict pier, but they are marooned when their boat drifts away. Warden Hodges spots their signal light and rows out to tell them to switch it off, but his boat sinks and he is stranded with them. Comedy first broadcast in 1969, starring Arthur Lowe and Bill Pertwee.(n)

programme.title: Sgt Pepper's Musical Revolution - with Howard Goodall
programme.desc: The composer explores why the Beatles' 50-year-old album is still revered as an innovative, revolutionary and influential release. With the help of out-takes, studio conversations between the band and never-heard-before outside of Abbey Road, Howard gets `under the bonnet' of the album, taking the music apart and reassembling it to reveal how it works. Producer George Martin and his team constructed the album sound by sound, layer by layer - a formula that became the norm for just about every rock act who followed.(n)

programme.title: The Sapphires
programme.desc: An Irish music manager discovers four Aboriginal Australian singers in a remote mission in the 1960s, and plans to turn them into their country's answer to the Supremes. The naive girls face a challenging journey to stardom when they are sent to entertain American troops in the Vietnam War. Drama, starring Deborah Mailman and Chris O'Dowd.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: Sri Lanka v South Africa. Action from the latest match of the tournament, which saw the Group B teams face each other at The Oval.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Eighties
programme.desc: Showcasing a selection of musical performances from the BBC archives, including Kool and the Gang, the Pointer Sisters, Grace Jones, Cameo, Bobby Womack, Sade, Alexander O'Neal and Whitney Houston.(n)

programme.title: The Good Old Days
programme.desc: Leonard Sachs chairs the old-time music hall programme, inviting Roy Castle, David Kernan, June Marlow, Deryk Parkin, Alan Randall, and performers from the Players' Theatre, London, to entertain an audience at the Leeds City Varieties. First aired February 2, 1979.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.sub-title: Temptations, Michael Jackson and the Real Thing.
programme.desc: Studio and concert performance from the decade, featuring the Temptations, the Real Thing and Michael Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1984.
programme.desc: Contributors including Howard Jones, Nik Kershaw, Paul Young, Nigel Planer and Midge Ure recall the year of big hair and big tunes, when a BBC ban on Frankie Goes to Hollywood's Relax led to an embarrassing gap on the show when it reached the top of the chart. The year saw the rise of one-man acts such as Nik Kershaw and Howard Jones, while Sade brought a stripped-back soulful vibe to jazz pop. German singer Nena hit the top spot with 99 Red Balloons, while the Special AKA's Free Nelson Mandela combined a political message with an irresistible tune. The year ended with the stars of the day pooling their talents with Band Aid's charity single Do They Know It's Christmas?.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops 1984: Big Hits.
programme.desc: A compilation of performances, featuring the Smiths, Duran Duran, Sade, the Weather Girls, Wham! and Bronski Beat. Further stellar appearances come from the show's debuts of iconic Americans Madonna, Miami Sound Machine and Cyndi Lauper - who runs riot in the studio. Frankie Goes to Hollywood celebrate their chart dominance of the year with one of their celebrated renditions of Two Tribes, while a less credible but arguably more memorable ditty comes courtesy of Black Lace.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.sub-title: Arena: Loretta Lynn - Still a Mountain Girl.
programme.desc: The veteran country music singer-songwriter looks back at her life from being born a coal miner's daughter in Kentucky, to selling over 45 million albums worldwide and to receiving the Presidential Medal of Freedom from President Barack Obama in 2013. Contributors include Willie Nelson, Sheryl Crow, Garth Brooks, Jack White and Sissy Spacek.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1984.
programme.desc: Contributors including Howard Jones, Nik Kershaw, Paul Young, Nigel Planer and Midge Ure recall the year of big hair and big tunes, when a BBC ban on Frankie Goes to Hollywood's Relax led to an embarrassing gap on the show when it reached the top of the chart. The year saw the rise of one-man acts such as Nik Kershaw and Howard Jones, while Sade brought a stripped-back soulful vibe to jazz pop. German singer Nena hit the top spot with 99 Red Balloons, while the Special AKA's Free Nelson Mandela combined a political message with an irresistible tune. The year ended with the stars of the day pooling their talents with Band Aid's charity single Do They Know It's Christmas?.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops 1984: Big Hits.
programme.desc: A compilation of performances, featuring the Smiths, Duran Duran, Sade, the Weather Girls, Wham! and Bronski Beat. Further stellar appearances come from the show's debuts of iconic Americans Madonna, Miami Sound Machine and Cyndi Lauper - who runs riot in the studio. Frankie Goes to Hollywood celebrate their chart dominance of the year with one of their celebrated renditions of Two Tribes, while a less credible but arguably more memorable ditty comes courtesy of Black Lace.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.sub-title: Arena: Loretta Lynn - Still a Mountain Girl.
programme.desc: The veteran country music singer-songwriter looks back at her life from being born a coal miner's daughter in Kentucky, to selling over 45 million albums worldwide and to receiving the Presidential Medal of Freedom from President Barack Obama in 2013. Contributors include Willie Nelson, Sheryl Crow, Garth Brooks, Jack White and Sissy Spacek.(n)

programme.title: Saints and Sinners: Britain's Millennium of Monasteries
programme.desc: Dr Janina Ramirez learns how the rich and powerful monasteries that had dominated British society for 1,000 years were turned to ruin within less than a five-year period. During the 15th century many monks were living in palatial monasteries and were patrons of the finest art and architecture. Janina learns how the arrival of the printing press put paid to their monopoly of publishing and education, before she traces the story of their dissolution under the rule of Henry VIII and Thomas Cromwell. She investigates whether the act was that of a over-bearing monarch or the inevitable end to an outmoded institution. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Search for Alfred the Great
programme.desc: Neil Oliver follows the work of the team of historians and scientists trying to discover the final resting place of the remains of 9th-century English king Alfred the Great, with the monarch's bones having been moved so many times over the years that many people concluded that they were lost for ever. Travelling from Winchester to Rome, Neil also tells the story of Alfred's life, revealing a man who forged a united language and identity and laid the foundations of the English nation.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: New series. Disgraced detective John Cardinal is brought back into the heart of a Northern Ontario homicide investigation unit when the body of a 13-year-old girl, previously reported missing, is discovered in Algonquin Bay. Crime thriller, based on the John Cardinal Mysteries series by Canadian author Giles Blunt, starring Billy Campbell.(n)

programme.desc: The Algonquin Bay PD tries to make amends with the community for the botched investigation into Katie Pine's disappearance, and Delorme places herself at odds with Cardinal.(n)
