programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter faces a backlash over a misogynistic comic strip so the Griffins flee Quahog, and find themselves in Springfield, home to the Simpsons. However, when their car is stolen they become stuck in the town.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve turns up at a baseball game wearing a Star Trek costume - much to the embarrassment of Stan, who refuses to be seen with him. However, a dental disaster forces a change of heart, and the pair team up to catch a terrorist at a sci-fi convention. Guest starring Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan reveals his real father is actually a super-suave spy and quits his job with the CIA to join him on an important mission. Francine is none too pleased with her husband's change of role and realises things are not quite what they seem when FBI agents show up looking for an international jewel thief.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Quagmire and Joe take a trip to Canada on a private jet, which crashes into the wilderness. Peter goes in search of help when Quagmire breaks his legs, but after two months in the wild, he becomes feral and finds it hard to communicate with his family when he finally returns home.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie's beloved teddy bear Rupert gets recalled, and he will stop at nothing to get him back. Meanwhile, Peter falls ill and Lois takes his place at a bowling tournament, but he becomes jealous when she gets a little too close to one of his team-mates.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Things become awkward between Hayley and her husband Jeff when she regresses to her six-year-old self. Meanwhile, Steve and his friends purchase a slow-cooker.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve helps Stan fix a problem with his office computer, but feels slighted by his father's colleagues when they claim he isn't `CIA material'. Then he is approached by the NSA, the CIA's nerdy arch-rivals, who make him an offer he cannot refuse. Meanwhile, committed vegetarian Hayley accidentally eats meat, and realises she still loves the taste.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Cleveland returns to Quahog, but he and Peter are not allowed to spend time together after Lois and Donna get into a big fight over their parenting styles.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Chris interrupt Stewie's TV time, prompting the angry baby to go back in time to break up Peter and Lois so he's never conceived. However, he is instead reborn into a Downton Abbey-esque British household.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan thinks his chances of promotion are over when Hayley disrupts the CIA family carnival. However, when he pays Director Bullock a home visit to apologise, he discovers his badly behaved daughter is the boss's new girlfriend.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan takes personal responsibility for Steve's sex education - but his advice is taken much too literally. Meanwhile, Roger gets a job as a barman in the hope of bettering himself. Animation, with the voices of Seth McFarlane and Scott Grimes.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A man who died after being knocked down by a van is revealed to be a professional hitman responsible for at least six contract killings - and his next target was to be a navy lieutenant commander. Meanwhile, Abby is delighted at being a match for a teenager who needs a kidney transplant, but she is informed that someone else with very similar DNA has also been identified as suitable. Has she found a relative she never knew about? Guest starring Brett Tucker (Neighbours).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a coastguard officer on board an abandoned cargo ship draws the team's attention to a family of Lebanese refugees hoping to find a new home in America. Meanwhile, Tony and McGee try to find the perfect woman for Gibbs. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The body of a Navy lieutenant is found on the side of a remote road and toxicology tests reveal he died of overhydration. When another man is found dead nearby, the NCIS team begins to suspect a serial killer is on the loose. Meanwhile, Ducky introduces Gibbs to his new girlfriend. Crime drama, guest starring Cheryl Ladd.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Homeland Security employee Victor Sterling mysteriously disappears and his car is found at a drive-through restaurant that becomes the scene of a double murder. To complicate matters further, the missing man's outspoken spouse happens to be the ex-wife of both Gibbs and Fornell. American naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, Joe Spano, Tom Gallop and Melinda McGraw.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of dead US marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Torres brings out old case notes and contacts when a US Marine's murder is linked to a dirt-bike gang, one that he joined as part of an undercover sting operation.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine Sergeant is found dead in a national park, forcing Gibbs and his team to collaborate with Mounted Police Sergeant May Dawson to solve a string of related crimes.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A pupil at a school for troubled youngsters is found beaten to death in a forest. A hand-drawn map discovered in a dormitory leads Kimball and Wayne to a run-down shack where they find a volatile man who has been harassed by a secretive gang of children hurling paint at his property, shouting abuse and breaking his windows. Suspecting the group could be behind the boy's death, Patrick sets up an elaborate sting involving a campfire, a ghost story and a willing volunteer. Simon Baker stars.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A 19-year-old girl is dumped in California after being stabbed to death, with her twin sister still missing and the crime bearing the hallmarks of Red John. A love letter leads the team to a blind woman who is able to provide a rough description of the killer using her other senses, prompting Patrick to put his life on the line in a bid to catch the man who murdered his own family. Dexter's Geoff Pierson guest stars, with Simon Baker, Robin Tunney and Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane employs dubious tactics to catch the killer of a woman who was accused of stealing $1million from her employer. Setting up camp in an empty house near the victim's home, he pins a mysterious note to the door and settles back to wait, optimistic the killer will fall for the bait. Elsewhere, a messy result in another case leads CBI boss Virgil Minelli to take Lisbon off the Red John investigation. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and the team are called to Sacramento, where the body of an aide to state senator Melinda Batson has been found. They arrest her stepbrother on suspicion of murder, but Jane believes political blackmail could have been the motive behind the killing, and begins his own investigation into the case. Crime drama, guest starring Paul Michael Glaser (Starsky and Hutch), with Simon Baker, Robin Tunney and Fay Masterson.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A child molester Lisbon caught and convicted in San Francisco is found shot dead near CBI headquarters in Sacramento, but when the gun is found to have her prints on it, she is accused of the murder. Unable to remember the night of the crime, she tries to prove her innocence by undergoing a polygraph test - which she fails, leaving her no choice but to ask Jane for help. Drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Damian, the owner of Doffo Winery in Temecula, California, contacts Charles after noticing wine barrels missing from stock.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: The chef prepares a roasted shrimp with feta in exchange for an ice cream master-class from friend and creamery owner Rori Trovato.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares tomato crostini and whipped feta. Plus, she makes thyme roasted marcona almonds as a cocktail snack.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: American chef Ina Garten prepares lobster salad with lemon mayonnaise, and learns how to make torte au chocolat at the Michelin-starred Auberge du Soleil.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: American chef Ina Garten enjoys a casual dinner in the garden and prepares Israeli couscous and tuna salad, with raspberry crumble bars for dessert.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking, including steak Oscar; fillet topped with roasted asparagus spears.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond invites friends and family over for a festive get-together and rustles up food including tenderloin sandwiches.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond embarks on a big food-shopping trip, buying chicken thighs to prepare peach and whiskey chicken.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ladd is busy coaching at a football training camp, so Ree makes lunch for 120 hungry staff and children, whipping up a picnic of hot roast beef sandwiches.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver provides tips on hosting a barbecue and demonstrates simple rules that guarantee properly cooked food every time. He also shows the best ways to cook everything on the grill, including chicken, ribs and shellfish, before revealing his recipe for the perfect marinade.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver cooks three dishes to show the versatility of beans, using legumes he picked from his garden - home-made baked borlotti beans, a hearty runner bean stew and a marinated French bean salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver focuses on dishes containing onions, garlic and leeks, using them to produce simple meals including a salad, soup, and roast pork with an onion and potato al forno. He also chats to a gardener about the health benefits of raw garlic.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver uses a variety of carrots in an Indian salad, demonstrates how they can be used to complement a pork chop and discovers why the vegetable is orange. He then prepares foil-roasted smoked beetroot with beef and a cottage cheese dressing.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver rustles up simple, seasonal dishes and demonstrates how to cook using home-grown potatoes. Among the dishes on the menu are Spanish omelette and a roast chicken tray bake with tomatoes. Outside in the garden, Brian shows how tasty spuds can be cultivated in the smallest of spaces.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Actor Hugh Bonneville joins Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty to relive his Far Eastern travels and treats the cafe diners to an authentic pad thai. Jamie makes the ultimate roast with his overnight shoulder of pork, while Jimmy builds a smoker to create a barbecue brisket, and the two unite to prepare a feast when they take on the sell-by label adherence that leads to thousands of tons of food being binned.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits two of the most famous hot-dog vendors in Hartford, Connecticut.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman heads to the Broken Yolk restaurant in San Diego, where he tackles an enormous omelette in the Ironman Challenge.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman takes on the Hellfire Challenge in Salt Lake City, in which he must consume a platter of extremely spicy sushi rolls and three other fiery dishes.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: During a visit to Cleveland, Ohio, Adam Richman tries to finish the Melt Bar and Grilled restaurant's 5lb grilled-cheese sandwich challenge.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman heads to Phoenix, Arizona, and goes against the clock when he tries to devour 12 slider-style hamburgers with onion rings in half an hour.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Boulder, Colorado, where he takes on the West End Wing King Challenge and must eat a bucket of 50 buffalo wings to achieve success.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, Adam Richman tries to eat a 9lb steak platter in less than 40 minutes in the Sleeping Cow challenge.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman is in Richmond, Virginia, where he goes up against the clock to eat eight super-spicy chicken wings in less than 30 minutes.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: At New York's Port Royal Pub and Grille, Adam Richman tackles the Davy Jones Locker Challenge, a huge platter of seafood that only one person has ever finished.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Oklahoma City, Adam Richman takes on a challenge in which he must eat 29 deep-fried catfish fillets.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman tries the Ultimate Destroyer Challenge at Papa Bob's Bar-B-Que in Kansas City, where he must eat a foot-long sandwich containing 5lb of smoked meat in 45 minutes.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Indianapolis to try the Big Ugly Burger Challenge at Bub's Burger Ice Cream.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits New Jersey to take on the Ludicrous Wings challenge - consuming 12 super spicy hot wings in 15 minutes or less.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A former client wants to invest in a failing California restaurant, but the Mystery Diners discover the current owner is not being honest about all of his problems.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After noticing discrepancies with the catering company she uses for her art shows, Patricia contacts Mystery Diners, but they discover a bigger problem with the assistant curator.(n)

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: The Layover
programme.desc: Anthony discovers ingratiating hosts and a culinary paradise in Taipei, and heads to one of the famed night markets that offer an array of mouthwatering options to choose from.(n)

programme.sub-title: Yours Truly - If You're Not Careful.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

Christmas special from 1986, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: It seems that everyone in the Brown family has a date for Valentine's Day except Agnes, so she turns to the internet to find herself a man. Dermot tries to come up with a loving gesture to prove to Maria he can still be romantic - but he makes the mistake of taking advice from Buster - while Agnes and Winnie are fascinated by Betty's sex manual and Grandad ends up addicted to Viagra. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: With the family stuffed full of turkey and Nana supping snowballs like there's no tomorrow, it can mean only one thing - Christmas at the Royles', who are celebrating in typical fashion by congregating round the TV. But this year they have special guests - none other than the parents of Antony's posh girlfriend Emma. Ricky Tomlinson, Sue Johnston, Caroline Aherne and Craig Cash star in the Christmas show from 2000, with guest appearances by Sharon Duce and John Henshaw.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Dave grows a goatee beard and the Royles throw a party to celebrate baby David's christening. Comedy, starring Ricky Tomlinson and Caroline Aherne.(n)

programme.title: Bridget & Eamon
programme.desc: The couple start a lucrative business when the holy statue in their front room begins to move every hour, but Fr Gabriel is not so sure it is a real miracle.(n)

programme.title: Bridget & Eamon
programme.desc: Summer has finally arrived and the sun is out, but Bridget and Eamon's decision to use cooking oil as suntan lotion leads to trouble for the couple.(n)

programme.title: Spaced

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Archive chats with Peter Cook and Dudley Moore, the double act that changed the face of British comedy. Straight from the Oxbridge Footlights, the irreverent, surreal and controversial duo were at the forefront of the new satire and alternative comedy boom of the 1960s, leaving behind a much imitated legacy of laughs. Dawn French narrates.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets his hands on a statue of a Hindu god - which plunges him into the middle of an age-old feud between rival families. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: One of Del's old flames turns up out of the blue, so Rodney and Grandad resolve to extinguish any passion that might still be smouldering in the Peckham wide boy's heart. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy acquires three tons of lead sheeting, which turns out to be a DIY nuclear fallout shelter, so he, Rodney and Grandad collect their sleeping bags and food and have a practice run to make sure they will know what to do if the Russians attack.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: After lending assistance to a wealthy woman in distress, Del seizes a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to improve his social standing by launching his own chandelier-cleaning business. As part of the venture, he ropes a reluctant Rodney and Grandad into helping him. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.desc: Del-Boy cannot believe his ears when Rodney tells him he has found a girlfriend. The trouble is, the woman is old enough to be his mother - and to make matters worse, her husband is about to be released from prison.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del jumps at the opportunity to decorate the local Chinese restaurant to make a quick profit, and the results are outstanding in more ways than one. Comedy, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del takes up cards in his latest bid to make his first million - much to the annoyance of Rodney and Grandad, who reckon he will end up gambling away all their worldly goods. Comedy with the wheeler-dealing Trotter family, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve Coogan is commissioned to review half a dozen restaurants for a Sunday newspaper and plans the trip with his American girlfriend - only to face the prospect of a week of meals-for-one after she dumps him. So Steve calls old friend Rob Brydon to accompany him, and the pair find themselves debating the big questions of life over a series of delightful dishes. Improvised comedy in which the stars play versions of themselves, directed by Michael Winterbottom.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve and Rob enjoy a taster menu at L'Enclume in the Cumbrian village of Cartmel as they continue their culinary tour of the north of England, reviewing restaurants for a Sunday newspaper. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve and Rob continue their culinary tour of the north of England in the Lake District. They stay at Samuel Taylor Coleridge's old home Greta Hall in Keswick, visit William Wordsworth's former residence Dove Cottage, and have lunch at Holbeck Ghyll. Starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Fran returns from holiday and discovers Manny has resigned and started work at Goliath Books, leaving Bernard to run the shop alone. After sifting through rubbish, rotting food and dead badgers, she resolves to get the errant employee back - but his new boss has no intention of letting him go. With Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig, and guest star Simon Pegg.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef prepares a Sunday lunch of slow-roasted shoulder pork, mackerel salad and her take on the traditional trifle. She also learns how to smoke her own fish in a biscuit tin.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef creates fuss-free recipes fit for summer, including quesadillas, seared steak salad and salmon with tomato and basil. She also meets the country's only buffalo mozzarella producer, and the ladies of the Irish Countrywomen's Association try one of Rachel's recipes.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry tackle the challenges that they set the bakers during the bread and desserts weeks of the fifth series of The Great British Bake Off. Paul gives step-by-step instructions on how to prepare ciabatta, a Roquefort and walnut loaf, and chocolate volcano fondant puddings, while Mary demonstrates how to make her layered tiramisu cake and a flamboyant Neapolitan baked Alaska.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the third quarter-final and the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from kitchen scraps, including bones and offcuts, fish skins, overripe fruit, cheese and stale bread. After an elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Charles Campion, Tracey MacLeod and Jay Rayner, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers reach Spain on the final leg of their journey in search of Europe's finest baking. Travelling across the northern part of the country, they begin in St Sebastian, sampling delicacies including goose barnacles and pinchos - large tapas - and visiting a Basque dining club. Moving on, the duo bake dishes such as the Spanish bread pan rustico and a seafood empanada packed with locally caught fish. They also make a giant spelt sausage roll filled with chorizo, and join in with an ancient pagan ceremony in Galicia, before heading to Santiago de Compostela, where they end their 5,000-mile journey at a spectacular firework display to celebrate the 800th anniversary of St James. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: A pared-down approach to cuisine in which the domestic goddess reveals that what people cook and how they prepare it really can make them feel better and more alive. Nigella prepares her avocado toast with radishes for breakfast, a Thai noodle dish with cinnamon and prawns, and a laid-back family supper of seeded lamb ribs, served with a feta and avocado salad. Nigella also serves her warm-spiced cauliflowers and `chicksalad' and a sweet treat in the form of an apricot almond cake.(n)

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson treats her supper guests to a feast of lamb chops with mint, chilli and potatoes, served alongside roasted red onions with fennel and basil. Dessert is a true Anglo-Italian affair with a plum and amaretti crumble. There are also recipes for farro risotto with mushrooms, and chocolate pasta with a dark butterscotch sauce.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall gets preparations for the strawberry fete under way with his gardeners, planting seeds in every available place to ensure large crop yields. The chef spends an evening fishing for river trout as he gathers ideas for what to serve his guests, and apprentice Sarah Bilson is challenged to prepare the perfect sweet scone to earn her place in the baking team.(n)

programme.desc: A pared-down approach to cuisine in which the domestic goddess reveals that what people cook and how they prepare it really can make them feel better and more alive. Nigella prepares her avocado toast with radishes for breakfast, a Thai noodle dish with cinnamon and prawns, and a laid-back family supper of seeded lamb ribs, served with a feta and avocado salad. Nigella also serves her warm-spiced cauliflowers and `chicksalad' and a sweet treat in the form of an apricot almond cake.(n)

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson treats her supper guests to a feast of lamb chops with mint, chilli and potatoes, served alongside roasted red onions with fennel and basil. Dessert is a true Anglo-Italian affair with a plum and amaretti crumble. There are also recipes for farro risotto with mushrooms, and chocolate pasta with a dark butterscotch sauce.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall gets preparations for the strawberry fete under way with his gardeners, planting seeds in every available place to ensure large crop yields. The chef spends an evening fishing for river trout as he gathers ideas for what to serve his guests, and apprentice Sarah Bilson is challenged to prepare the perfect sweet scone to earn her place in the baking team.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers reach Spain on the final leg of their journey in search of Europe's finest baking. Travelling across the northern part of the country, they begin in St Sebastian, sampling delicacies including goose barnacles and pinchos - large tapas - and visiting a Basque dining club. Moving on, the duo bake dishes such as the Spanish bread pan rustico and a seafood empanada packed with locally caught fish. They also make a giant spelt sausage roll filled with chorizo, and join in with an ancient pagan ceremony in Galicia, before heading to Santiago de Compostela, where they end their 5,000-mile journey at a spectacular firework display to celebrate the 800th anniversary of St James. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the third quarter-final and the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from kitchen scraps, including bones and offcuts, fish skins, overripe fruit, cheese and stale bread. After an elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Charles Campion, Tracey MacLeod and Jay Rayner, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.desc: Clarissa Dickson Wright and Jennifer Paterson get a taste of the high life as they dine at the Duke of Hamilton's magnificent stately pile. Dishes include rabbit with anchovies and capers, medallions of venison, roast grouse and partridge.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals begin with the eight hopefuls split into teams of four and challenged to the Relay Invention test, in which both groups must come up with a single dish between them. Using a chicken and a range of vegetables, herbs and spices, each team member has just 20 minutes to make their contribution - but as they cannot speak, they must leave clues behind to help their team-mates decipher what the dish is supposed to be.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The knockout stage continues, and if the amateurs thought it was tough getting this far, the upcoming round will really sort the dishwashers from the chefs. Over the next two nights the remaining contestants are split into two groups and get their first taste of professional cooking. Tonight's hopefuls head to London restaurant Typing Room, overseen by Lee Westcott, where they serve up every dish during a busy lunchtime service. Then it's back to the studio for an Invention Test - but adding to the pressure, they'll be presenting their food to MasterChef: The Professionals judge and formidable perfectionist Monica Galetti. After this, one of them will be hanging up their apron and going home.(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Blurb. Selina works on her book as her staff prepare for the ceremony to unveil her portrait. Meanwhile, Jonah tries to weasel his way onto the guest list; and Dan struggles to solve his on-screen chemistry problem(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Brian Helgeland (Payback) wrote and directed this crime drama about the rise and fall of two of the most notorious gangsters in England's history: the Kray twins. Tom Hardy stars as both Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twins who rose to prominence in London's underworld in the 1950s and '60s, using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen to seize control of the city. The film is adapted from John Pearson's nonfiction tome The Profession of Violence. Emily Browning, David Thewlis, Taron Egerton, Christopher Eccleston, Chazz Palminteri, and Paul Bettany co-star(n)

programme.title: Steel
programme.desc: NBA superstar Shaquille O'Neal stars in this action-packed caper as a devoted soldier who leaves the military after his top-secret project is sabotaged. He teams up with a scientist to create a superpowered suit of steel to help battle crime after he learns that his special weapons are being used on the streets(n)

programme.title: Simon Birch
programme.desc: Ian Michael Smith is a tiny bundle of joy as the star of this moving tale of friendship and faith. Simon Birch is a boy so small that at age 12 he plays the infant Jesus in a Christmas pageant. But Simon believes God has a special plan for him and sets out on a spiritual quest, joined by his best friend. Ashley Judd, Oliver Platt, Joseph Mazzello, Jim Carrey(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller about a security guard who, having been the sole survivor of a high-fatality train crash, finds himself at the centre of a mysterious theory that explains his consistent physical good fortune. When news of his survival is made public, a man whose own body is excessively weak tracks him down in an attempt to explain his unique unbreakable nature(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: The youngest child of the family often has the most problems -- so why should things be different for the Prince of Darkness and his offspring? Satan (Harvey Keitel) is considering retirement, and is pondering which of his sons should take over the family business -- ambitious Adrian (Rhys Ifans), strapping Cassius (Tommy "Tiny" Lister Jr.), or Nicky (Adam Sandler), an accident-prone demon who prefers to stay in his room playing his favorite heavy metal tunes. When Satan decides to stay on for another 10,000 years, Adrian is outraged, and leaves Hell to go to New York, where he and Cassius attempt to round up enough souls to vote Satan out of power. Satan, understandably upset, sends Nicky to bring Adrian and Cassius back home, but Nicky finds life on Earth is more complicated than he expected. Things don't get any easier when he develops a crush on Valerie (Patricia Arquette), a good-hearted mortal woman. Little Nicky also features Michael McKean as a city official trying to put Nicky behind bars, Kevin Nealon as Hell's gatekeeper, Rodney Dangerfield as Satan's father, Robert Smigel as the voice of Beefy -- a talking dog who is Nicky's guide on earth, Allen Covert as Todd -- Nicky's new roommate, and Peter Dante and Jonathan Loughran as a pair of metalheads who dig Satan. Jon Lovitz and Reese Witherspoon play cameo roles, and Regis Philbin and Ozzy Osbourne appear as themselves(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Kirsten Sheridan's family drama stars Freddie Highmore as Evan Taylor, a musical prodigy searching for his parents. When pregnant cellist Lyla Novacek was hit by a car, her controlling father and manager told her she'd lost the baby; in reality she gave birth prematurely and her father sent the infant to an orphanage. Eleven years later, when Evan finds out that his parents are alive, he sets out to find them, taking inspiration from the music around him. The heart of the film is Evan's almost mystical ability to 'feel' music, a challenging concept that is rendered believable thanks to inventive work from the composer of the main score, Mark Mancina. Also starring Jonathan Rhys Meyers as Evan's rock singer father, and Robin Williams as a modern-day Fagin who Evan meets during his search for his family(n)

programme.title: Get Smart

Partnered with sexy and capable Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), he navigates the world of multifunction pocketknives and exploding dental floss to hilarious effect. programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman (Ben Affleck) and Superman (Henry Cavill) clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world, while the public they're defending is becoming increasingly mindful of the damage that superheroes and masked vigilantes cause. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by nefarious billionaire Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg). Directed by Zack Snyder, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice also co-stars Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jeremy Irons as Alfred the butler, and Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Brian Helgeland (Payback) wrote and directed this crime drama about the rise and fall of two of the most notorious gangsters in England's history: the Kray twins. Tom Hardy stars as both Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twins who rose to prominence in London's underworld in the 1950s and '60s, using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen to seize control of the city. The film is adapted from John Pearson's nonfiction tome The Profession of Violence. Emily Browning, David Thewlis, Taron Egerton, Christopher Eccleston, Chazz Palminteri, and Paul Bettany co-star(n)

programme.title: Steel
programme.desc: NBA superstar Shaquille O'Neal stars in this action-packed caper as a devoted soldier who leaves the military after his top-secret project is sabotaged. He teams up with a scientist to create a superpowered suit of steel to help battle crime after he learns that his special weapons are being used on the streets(n)

programme.title: Simon Birch
programme.desc: Ian Michael Smith is a tiny bundle of joy as the star of this moving tale of friendship and faith. Simon Birch is a boy so small that at age 12 he plays the infant Jesus in a Christmas pageant. But Simon believes God has a special plan for him and sets out on a spiritual quest, joined by his best friend. Ashley Judd, Oliver Platt, Joseph Mazzello, Jim Carrey(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller about a security guard who, having been the sole survivor of a high-fatality train crash, finds himself at the centre of a mysterious theory that explains his consistent physical good fortune. When news of his survival is made public, a man whose own body is excessively weak tracks him down in an attempt to explain his unique unbreakable nature(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: The youngest child of the family often has the most problems -- so why should things be different for the Prince of Darkness and his offspring? Satan (Harvey Keitel) is considering retirement, and is pondering which of his sons should take over the family business -- ambitious Adrian (Rhys Ifans), strapping Cassius (Tommy "Tiny" Lister Jr.), or Nicky (Adam Sandler), an accident-prone demon who prefers to stay in his room playing his favorite heavy metal tunes. When Satan decides to stay on for another 10,000 years, Adrian is outraged, and leaves Hell to go to New York, where he and Cassius attempt to round up enough souls to vote Satan out of power. Satan, understandably upset, sends Nicky to bring Adrian and Cassius back home, but Nicky finds life on Earth is more complicated than he expected. Things don't get any easier when he develops a crush on Valerie (Patricia Arquette), a good-hearted mortal woman. Little Nicky also features Michael McKean as a city official trying to put Nicky behind bars, Kevin Nealon as Hell's gatekeeper, Rodney Dangerfield as Satan's father, Robert Smigel as the voice of Beefy -- a talking dog who is Nicky's guide on earth, Allen Covert as Todd -- Nicky's new roommate, and Peter Dante and Jonathan Loughran as a pair of metalheads who dig Satan. programme.desc: The people of Covington, a small town in rural Pennsylvania lead peaceful lives, only rarely disturbed by the creatures that inhabit the woods surrounding the village. An agreement has been reached with the creatures and peace prevails under the condition that the boundaries are respected. Yet this balance is disrupted when Lucius Hunt (Joaquin Phoenix), an inquisitive and willful young man, ventures himself beyond the limits of the village. After this, things will never be the same. Written and directed by M. Night Shyamalan, this is his third film after the huge success of The Sixth Sense(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: After the highly acclaimed independent film Bottle Rocket, director Wes Anderson followed up with a quirky Touchstone Studios film entitled Rushmore. Written by Anderson and friend Owen Wilson (an actor in Armageddon and Anaconda), they created the story of Max Fischer, a highly eccentric 15-year-old boy who attends the tenth grade at Rushmore Academy. Played by Jason Schwartzman (Talia Shire's son and Francis Ford Coppola's nephew), Max is a poor student with big dreams and a love of extracurricular activities. Max is editor of the school newspaper and yearbook, president of the chess, astronomy, French, and German clubs, captain of the fencing team, and director of the school play. Max is also a compulsive liar, telling everyone that his barber father (Seymour Cassel) is really a brain surgeon. Suddenly Max falls in love with Miss Cross (Olivia Williams), a first-grade teacher at the school. He also makes a new friend in business tycoon Mr. Blume (Bill Murray), an eccentric millionaire who also loves Miss Cross. The love triangle heats up as Max refuses to believe that his age has anything to do with Miss Cross refusing his romantic advances. Also Max's scheme to erect an aquarium on the school baseball diamond gets him booted out of Rushmore Academy. As his life crumbles around him, he is forced to grow up and accept the consequences of his actions and his lies. He throws himself more into his extracurricular activities, hoping to redeem himself by staging the most ambitious school play ever attempted(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: After the highly acclaimed independent film Bottle Rocket, director Wes Anderson followed up with a quirky Touchstone Studios film entitled Rushmore. Written by Anderson and friend Owen Wilson (an actor in Armageddon and Anaconda), they created the story of Max Fischer, a highly eccentric 15-year-old boy who attends the tenth grade at Rushmore Academy. Played by Jason Schwartzman (Talia Shire's son and Francis Ford Coppola's nephew), Max is a poor student with big dreams and a love of extracurricular activities. Max is editor of the school newspaper and yearbook, president of the chess, astronomy, French, and German clubs, captain of the fencing team, and director of the school play. Max is also a compulsive liar, telling everyone that his barber father (Seymour Cassel) is really a brain surgeon. Suddenly Max falls in love with Miss Cross (Olivia Williams), a first-grade teacher at the school. He also makes a new friend in business tycoon Mr. Blume (Bill Murray), an eccentric millionaire who also loves Miss Cross. The love triangle heats up as Max refuses to believe that his age has anything to do with Miss Cross refusing his romantic advances. Also Max's scheme to erect an aquarium on the school baseball diamond gets him booted out of Rushmore Academy. As his life crumbles around him, he is forced to grow up and accept the consequences of his actions and his lies. He throws himself more into his extracurricular activities, hoping to redeem himself by staging the most ambitious school play ever attempted(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: In desperate need of a vacation after being unceremoniously dumped by his TV-star girlfriend, a man travels to a lavish Hawaiian resort to nurse his wounds and forget his heartache, only to discover that his ex and her handsome new boyfriend are currently staying at the exact same island hot spot. Peter Bretter (Jason Segel) may be just another struggling musician, but for the past six years he's been dating Sarah Marshall (Kristen Bell), one of the hottest stars on television. Sarah is everything in the world to Peter, so when she kindly but firmly tells him that they should each go their separate ways, he is absolutely devastated. Later, after attempting to salvage his ego by awkwardly attempting to become a womanizer and nearly losing his job because of a nervous breakdown, an emotionally fragile Peter attempts to put the past behind him by escaping to the sun-soaked beaches of Oahu. While at first it seems as if Peter has discovered the perfect prescription for a bad case of lost love, his plan soon turns to dust when Sarah and her new rock-star boyfriend, Aldous (Russell Brand), turn up at the exact same resort. Though accepting Sarah's lavish new lifestyle won't be easy for the crestfallen Peter, the laid-back companionship of flirtatious resort employee Rachel (Mila Kunis) -- not to mention a continuous regimen of fruity cocktails -- goes a long way in mending the wounds of a broken heart. Forgetting Sarah Marshall was penned by Segel and produced by Judd Apatow. Fun with Dick and Jane screenwriter Nicholas Stoller makes his directorial debut. The cast also includes Paul Rudd, Bill Hader, Jack McBrayer, and Jonah Hill(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Hugely successful businesswoman Michelle Darnell (Melissa McCarthy) is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she is forced to move in with a long-suffering employee of hers (Kristen Bell), and tries to earn redemption and revamp her public image by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies. Peter Dinklage, Kristen Schaal, and Kathy Bates co-star in this comedy, which was directed by Ben Falcone (McCarthy's real-life husband), and co-written by McCarthy, Falcone, and Steve Mallory(n)

programme.title: Ferrell Takes the Field
programme.desc: Will Ferrell plays baseball in five spring training games for 10 different teams on one day in March 2015 as a fund-raiser for cancer research, and to honor former major leaguer Bert Campaneris, who played every position in a game in 1965 for the Kansas City A's(n)

programme.title: King Ralph
programme.desc: Sometimes a family title, among the nobility of England, goes to the "collateral" heirs -- people not in the direct line of decent, like cousins, great-nephews and the like. On rare occasions, these people are not even aware that they are about to be elevated to the House of Lords, and they have been living more-or-less ordinary lives. In this comedy, the family which lacks direct heirs is the Royal Family of England -- as all of the likely heirs have died one after the other in swift succession. In this comedy, the "collateral heir" is an exuberant, fence-busting All-American slob (and pretty good rock n' roll musician) by the name of Ralph (John Goodman). Unknown to him, his grandmother had an affair with a royal prince. Ralph's a good guy, and eager to please. He recognizes the importance of the royal hoopla to England and works very hard to fit in as its new designated king. He is assisted by the ever-unctuous, very serious family factotum Willingham (Peter O'Toole). The trouble is, he doesn't have instincts for politics English-style, and he is constantly "putting a foot wrong," as they might say. The most difficult situation for him is when he develops a new love interest, and she's not "acceptable" to the upper crust. In addition to being hounded by the tabloids, he finds that "the good of the state" requires that he drop his new girlfriend. Things really come to a head just before Ralph's coronation as king. Reviewers generally loathed this feel-good comedy, but audiences seem to have enjoyed it tremendously, and it has done well in video and TV airings(n)

programme.title: Renaissance Man
programme.desc: Danny DeVito stars in this thoughtful comedy about Bill Rago, an advertising executive who gets fired from his job and is forced to take on an army job teaching poorly educated boot camp recruits to read. With a little ingenuity, he gets them reading Shakespeare's Hamlet, but finds opposition in the guise of Sgt Cass (Gregory Hines), who dislikes civilians and thinks he is wasting his time teaching screw-ups to think for themselves. Also stars Ed Begley Jr and a young Mark Wahlberg(n)

programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, in his breakthrough role, stars as Joel Goodson, a straight-A student left in charge of the house by his holidaying parents. Grabbing the Porsche, he heads downtown and picks up a glamorous hooker. She's on the run from her pimp and when she sees Joel's house, she has an idea: seduce him and persuade him to turn it into a high class bordello for just one night, so she and her friends can relieve his friends of their cash. All goes well until her pimp turns up looking for payback in Paul Brickman's sex comedy that rises above the genre to be both entertaining and provoking(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: Two neighbours, who have been bitter rivals ever since a youthful feud over a woman, renew their animosity when an attractive widow moves in across the street. The new arrival is a welcome diversion for the old adversaries, and when they both attempt to woo her, only one can win her affections. When it becomes clear that the widow is interested only in commitment and her new lover has other ideas, she begins to doubt her original decision(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Hawk-like Marine Corps officer Benson Payne (Damon Wayans) attempts to whip into shape the usual assortment of misfit JROTC kids in this minor remake of The Private War of Major Benson. Of course, both the major and his pint-sized recruits have something to teach one another. Payne teaches them the value of self-discipline and instills self-confidence in them, and the recruits teach him to stop and smell the roses (not to mention the fact that kids sometimes need coddling rather than screaming). And, of course, there is the annual JROTC statewide competition, which the kids are obligated to win before the movie can end. While there are some funny moments (the major's exhibition in full-dress whites at a school dance, for example), the script seems too color-by-numbers to be interesting to anyone other than undiscriminating younger viewers(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: Based on a true story, Frank W. Abagnale was employed as a doctor, a lawyer, and as a co-pilot for a major airline company-all before reaching his 21st birthday. A successful con artist and master of deception, Frank is also a brilliant forger, whose skill at check fraud has netted him millions of dollars in stolen funds - much to the chagrin of the authorities(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: Two neighbours, who have been bitter rivals ever since a youthful feud over a woman, renew their animosity when an attractive widow moves in across the street. The new arrival is a welcome diversion for the old adversaries, and when they both attempt to woo her, only one can win her affections. programme.title: MacArthur
programme.desc: Star Gregory Peck went into MacArthur disliking the title character that he was slated to play, but emerged from the experience with a deeper understanding and respect for this complex historical figure. The film is framed in flashback, with an octogenarian General Douglas MacArthur (Peck) making his final address before his alma mater of West Point. We flash back to the fall of Corregidor in 1942, with MacArthur promising "I shall return" to the beleaguered (and eventually imprisoned) American and Filipino troops. The story follows MacArthur's subsequent victories in the South Pacific, occasionally pausing to show us the General's omnipresent sense of "showmanship" (e.g. his wading ashore on the beaches of the Philippines for the benefit of the newsreel cameras). The greater part of the film involves MacArthur's attempts to restore dignity to the defeated postwar Japan, and to keep the Russian Communists from overtaking the orient as they had Eastern Europe. MacArthur is eventually fired from his post by President Truman after the general defies orders during the Korean conflict. MacArthur was intended as Universal's "answer" to 20th Century-Fox's enormously successful Patton (1970), but box-office returns were disappointing(n)

programme.title: Disney's The Kid
programme.desc: If you could talk to the child that you used to be, what advice would you give him? That question forms the basis of this comic fantasy. Forty-year-old Russ Duritz (Bruce Willis) is a wealthy and powerful "image consultant" who has made a career out of telling people how to present themselves. But while he's a success in business, he's a failure in life; he's vain, mean-spirited, and hasn't been able to hold onto a marriage (or even a pet dog). One day, Russ is startled to meet Rusty (Spencer Breslin), a stocky kid whom he soon realizes is himself at the age of eight, having passed through a wrinkle in time. Young Rusty doesn't seem much happier than the grown-up Russ, so the older man takes his younger self under his wing and tries to teach him how to avoid the mistakes he's made, while Rusty encourages Russ to be a more caring human being. Along the way, Russ and Rusty become friends, and realize how much they can learn from each other. Disney's The Kid also stars Jean Smart as one of Russ' clients, Lily Tomlin as his assistant, and Daniel Von Bargen as his father(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Based on the popular cartoon character, this family-oriented "ghost story" is about a not-so-scary spirit who bonds with a little girl (Christina Ricci). The eternally irritable Ms. Carrigan (Cathy Moriarty) discovers that the only thing she's been left in her recently departed father's will is a rickety old house in New England. Naturally, the woman is furious about this, until her "close personal friend" and assistant, Dibbs (Eric Idle of Monty Python fame), discovers a secret message that a treasure may be concealed somewhere in the house. The two take off for Maine, only to learn that the house is haunted by Casper "the friendly ghost" and his three ghostly uncles Stinky, Stretch, and Fatso. After futilely recruiting an exorcist (Don Novello, more or less reviving his Father Guido Sarducci character from Saturday Night Live) and a "professional ghost exterminator" (Dan Aykroyd), she brings in a "ghost psychiatrist" (Bill Pullman) and his daughter Kat (Ricci). Innocently attracted to the young girl, Casper befriends Kat as they try to save the ghosts' home from the evil Carrigan. Eye-popping special effects highlight this magical story that touches (albeit lightly) on the theme of what lies at the heart of human desires. Clint Eastwood, Rodney Dangerfield, Mel Gibson and The Crypt Keeper (of Tales from the Crypt) all make cameos as apparitions in the mirror Bill Pullman looks into in the house(n)

programme.title: The Wild Life
programme.desc: A restless parrot and his animal pals are shocked when a ragged human known as Robinson Crusoe washes ashore on their tropical island. Later, they decide to team up with Crusoe to save their home from a pair of conniving cats(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jackie Chan is a perfect fit in this stylish comedy-adventure about a cabbie-turned-chauffeur who fills in for his out-of-commission secret-agent boss by donning a high-tech suit that enables him to foil villains plotting to sabotage the world's water supply. Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, Debi Mazar, Ritchie Coster, Peter Stormare(n)

NFL greats Jim Brown and Lawrence Taylor have significant roles. Cameron Diaz, James Woods, LL Cool J(n)

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Michael Keaton is Bruce Wayne, an enigmatic millionaire who, following the trauma of witnessing his parent's death as a child, dons a voluminous black cape by night to become the Batman, a shadowy figure who haunts the streets of Gotham City, fighting crime wherever it rears its ugly head. And it doesn't come much uglier than The Joker, a cackling killer with a frozen rictus grin whose deadly laughing gas threatens to wipe out the population of Gotham(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky (Shia LaBeouf) and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes (Megan Fox) are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is the main impediment to them gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero... Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: A team of incarcerated supervillains, including Deadshot, Harley Quinn, Enchantress, El Diablo and Killer Croc, are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences(n)

programme.title: Assassins
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone stars as a seasoned hitman who has to face off against a younger, better looking rival in Antonio Banderas in Richard Donner's quick-fire action(n)

programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England(n)

programme.title: Doomsday

programme.title: Model for Murder
programme.desc: Seeking his dead brother's girlfriend, an American finds murder in London's fashion industry as he becomes embroiled in a jewelry robbery plot(n)

programme.title: Batman: The Killing Joke
programme.desc: The seminal graphic novel written by Alan Moore (Watchmen) that ushered in a new, darker spin on The Dark Knight is adapted for the screen in this animated feature. The Joker (voiced by Mark Hamill) launches his most diabolical assault ever upon Commissioner Gordon (Ray Wise) and his family, including his daughter Barbara Gordon (Tara Strong). It's up to Batman (Kevin Conroy) to stop this madman in his tracks - but in doing so, he'll realize how he and his arch nemesis are very much the same. Extras include featurettes, bonus cartoons, sneak peeks and more(n)

programme.title: Clean and Sober
programme.desc: The directorial debut of Glenn Gordon Caron, the creator of the television series Moonlighting (1985-89), this intense, gritty drama was received as one of the best-ever cinematic treatments of substance abuse. Michael Keaton stars as Daryl Poynter, a hustling, successful Philadelphia real estate agent who has become addicted to cocaine. He's already got problems, including nearly a $100,000 embezzled from his employer and lost on the stock market, when he wakes up one morning with a young woman dead in his bed from a coke overdose. His company is asking questions about the missing funds, and the dead girl's father is plastering his neighborhood with posters accusing Daryl of being a murderer, so he decides to hide out in an anonymous drug treatment program. There, however, Daryl runs into tough-minded counselor and former addict Craig (Morgan Freeman), who has heard all of Daryl's lies and tricks before. Daryl also finds romance with an abused fellow addict, Charlie Standers (Kathy Baker), and understanding with his Alcoholics Anonymous sponsor (M. Emmet Walsh)(n)

programme.title: The Bachelor
programme.desc: Jimmie is seeing his single friends get married one by one. Not something he's worried about, until his current girlfriend Anne catches the bouquet at his friend Marco's wedding. Feeling his wild partying days are numbered, he proposes to Anne, but botches the proposal so badly that Anne leaves town, insulted by his apparently defeatist attempt to tie the knot. After she's gone, Jimmie discovers that his recently-deceased grandfather's will stipulates he gets nothing of a multi-million dollar fortune unless he's married by 6.05pm on his 30th birthday, the very next day! Can he beat the clock in time to claim his inheritance?(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two straight-laced friends pose as drug dealers and try their best -- and sometimes fail -- to fit in with the thug circle in order to retrieve a stolen kitten(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: In this slick, slam-bang sequel mismatched cops head to Paris to unravel a plot by Triad gangs to assassinate a Chinese diplomat(n)

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: Back in the late 1970s, author Cameron Crowe banked upon his youthful appearance to pose as a teen-aged high school student. The results of his hands-on research was the revelatory book Fast Times at Ridgemont High, which went on to spectacular success as a theatrical feature. The sociological inner lining of Crowe's book was sacrificed in favor of standard teen-movie dialogue and Animal House-style comedy, but the film is impossible to dislike, and it spawned a legion of future imitators. Ostensibly, the main characters are brother and sister Jennifer Jason Leigh and Judge Reinhold. However, the real breakthrough star is Sean Penn as the perpetually zoned-out Jeff Spicoli. It is Penn who has the film's most famous scene, wherein the decorum of teacher Hand (Ray Walston)'s classroom is interrupted by a pizza delivery. Fast Times at Ridgemont High was spun off into a TV series, the short-lived 1986 weekly Fast Times(n)

programme.title: High Maintenance
programme.desc: Selfie. An aspiring writer persuades The Guy to stay for an interview, but it's interrupted by her social-media habits. Meanwhile, a former customer needs The Guy's help(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Brian Helgeland (Payback) wrote and directed this crime drama about the rise and fall of two of the most notorious gangsters in England's history: the Kray twins. Tom Hardy stars as both Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twins who rose to prominence in London's underworld in the 1950s and '60s, using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen to seize control of the city. The film is adapted from John Pearson's nonfiction tome The Profession of Violence. Emily Browning, David Thewlis, Taron Egerton, Christopher Eccleston, Chazz Palminteri, and Paul Bettany co-star(n)

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: Swashbuckling fantasy adventure in which immortals do battle with one another down the ages towards a final, decisive encounter. One of the combatants is a 16th-century Scot, wounded in battle, who is pursued to contemporary America by the most feared of all warriors - the Kurgan(n)

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Two gunmen become the marshal and deputy of a lawless Old West mining town and take on a corrupt rancher(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman (Ben Affleck) and Superman (Henry Cavill) clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world, while the public they're defending is becoming increasingly mindful of the damage that superheroes and masked vigilantes cause. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by nefarious billionaire Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg). Directed by Zack Snyder, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice also co-stars Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jeremy Irons as Alfred the butler, and Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman(n)

programme.title: Sinister 2
programme.desc: In this chilling sequel, two young brothers must defend themselves against a malevolent spirit that feeds on the corruption of innocence, and that documents its exploits in home movies(n)

programme.title: Under Siege 2: Dark Territory
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Steven Seagal as a chef who gets caught up in the hijacking of a train. Casey Ryback used to be a Navy SEAL, but he left it all behind and opted for a quieter life in catering. However, when he accompanies his niece on a cross-country train trip Ryback little suspects that he is about to be plunged into another life-or-death situation. The train is about to be taken over by Travis Dane, a psychopathic criminal who needs it to help him gain control of a high-tech satellite which could create havoc on Earth if it fell into the wrong hands. Ryback is on the scene - but can he do anything to stop Dane before it is too late?(n)

programme.title: Hostage
programme.desc: A cop looking for a quieter way of life is thrown into the most dangerous crisis of his life in this thriller based on the novel by Robert Crais. Jeff Talley (Bruce Willis) used to be a hostage negotiator with the Los Angeles Police Department, but after a standoff goes horribly wrong, Talley moves himself and his family to a small, quiet town of Bristo Camino, where he serves as chief of police. When three young criminals attempt to steal a car from a wealthy accountant, the situation quickly spins out of control and the thieves are trapped inside the heavily fortified home, taking the accountant and his family hostage. The Ventura County Sheriff's Department soon arrives on the scene, and Talley eagerly hands over the situation to them, but when he unexpectedly finds himself in telephone contact with one of the children inside, he begins to suspect that the cops are in over their heads. After he's approached by a masked stranger who has an agenda of his own, Talley is forced to decide if he should protect the safety of the family in the house or his own wife and kids. Hostage was the first English-language film from director Florent Emilio Siri(n)

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: Part thriller, part fantasy, starring James Caviezel as a NYPD detective still torn apart by the death of his fire-fighter father Dennis Quaid. Fiddling with his dad's 'ham' radio, he suddenly finds he can contact his dad before his death and warns him of the danger. But the altered future sees Quaid's wife murdered and now son and father must try and solve the riddle of the murderer's identity and change the time line again in Gregory Hoblit's infinitely fascinating film(n)

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Set amidst the burgeoning Seattle alternative music scene of the early '90s, Singles follows a group of twentysomethings as they try to find love and try to come to terms with their passage into adulthood. Arranged as an episodic comedy, the film follows a group of friends who live in the same apartment building and hang out at the same coffee shop. The central couple is Steve Dunne (Campbell Scott) and Linda Powell (Kyra Sedgwick), a pair who meet at an Alice In Chains concert and eventually fall in love. Singles follows the tumultuous relationship between Steve and Linda and their friendship with Janet Livermore (Bridget Fonda), who is trying to win the affection of grunge-rocker Cliff Poncier (Matt Dillon). The film also has a number of cameos, including actors Eric Stoltz, Tom Skerritt, Peter Horton, director Tim Burton and the film's author/director, Cameron Crowe. From the musical side of the fence, Singles features appearances by Sub Pop executive Bruce Pavitt, musicians Chris Cornell (Soundgarden), Pat DiNizio (Smithereens), Tad (Tad), and Pearl Jam's Eddie Vedder, Jeff Ament, and Stone Gossard, who play Dillon's backing band, Citizen Dick(n)

programme.title: Crimson Tide
programme.desc: A veteran sub captain and his first officer argue over a command to launch nuclear missiles against Russia. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos a young woman and brings her to his mansion atop a clay mountain. There, she learns that her new home holds many disturbing secrets as she fights for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina (Jennifer Saunders) and Patsy (Joanna Lumley) are horrified when they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party. Eager to avoid the media's glare, the duo flee to the French Riviera to get away from it all. Directed by Mandie Fletcher(n)

programme.title: Criminal
programme.desc: Sociopathic death-row inmate Jerico Stewart (Kevin Costner) is implanted with the memories of a deceased CIA agent (Ryan Reynolds) in a desperate attempt to thwart a deadly plot involving a Dutch hacker (Michael Pitt). At the same time, Jerico reconnects with his own humanity as he bonds with the late agent's family. Gary Oldman, Tommy Lee Jones, and Gal Gadot co-star in this espionage thriller directed by Ariel Vromen (The Iceman)(n)

programme.title: Smilla's Sense of Snow
programme.desc: Smilla Jaspersen, a Greenlander, lives in Copenhagen. A young boy falls to his death from the roof of her apartment building; his death is ruled an accident, yet Smilla, an expert on ice and snow, can tell from his footprints that he was running from someone. Smilla begins her own investigation, forming an uneasy friendship (and perhaps a romance) with her neighbor, a mechanic. Smilla uncovers a trail of clues, leading her towards a secretive corporation that has made several mysterious expeditions to Greenland. What are they looking for? Were they somehow responsible for the boy's death? We'll find the answer on Gela Alta, a frozen island off Greenland's western coast(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Huntsman: Winter's War'
programme.desc: A look at "The Huntsman: Winter's War," a 2016 prequel to "Snow White and the Huntsman" that follows the Huntsman and his secret lover Sara as they attempt to stop Freya the Ice Queen and her evil sister from conquering the forest. The film stars Chris Hemsworth, Charlize Theron and Emily Blunt, and is directed by Cedric Nicolas-Troyan(n)

programme.title: December Boys

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Eligible young people in New York City search for romance while living the single life with their friends(n)

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: On the eve of her sister's wedding, suburban teenager Samantha (Molly Ringwald) suffers silently as her family forgets her birthday. Even worse, some total dork (Anthony Michael Hall) keeps propositioning her with sophomoric innuendo when she really craves romantic attention from high-school hunk Jake (Michael Schoeffling). Moving from Samantha's family home as it's invaded by outre relatives to a high-school dance where nothing seems to go her way, this bittersweet teen comedy traces the hopes and disappointments of not only Samantha, but also a host of incidental but memorable characters, from a hapless Japanese exchange student to a prom queen and a posse of barely pubescent nerds. A climactic party scene at which these various strata of young America overcome their rigid hierarchies sets the stage for resolutions both tender and torrid(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Exuberant musical based on the hit stage show featuring the music of ABBA. 20-year-old Sophie lives on an idyllic Greek island with her free-spirited mother Donna. When Sophie gets engaged to her boyfriend, she decides that she wants her father at her wedding - but unfortunately, she does not know who her father is. She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? And is she as reluctant to see her former lovers as she claims?(n)

programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Gets Stuck in Traffic
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Gets Stuck in Traffic. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

Columbo is still the best man to solve the mysterious death of a popular mystery writer. Though he quickly finds the culprit, the killer has devised airtight alibis and Columbo must use all of his considerable faculties to trick him into a confession. Steven Spielberg's direction coupled with Steven Bochco's deft writing and Peter Falk's flawless portrayal of the laid-back gumshoe, makes "Murder by the Book" one of the series' finest episodes(n)

programme.title: Mystery Woman: Vision of a Murder
programme.desc: This Hallmark Channel TV movie is one of several starring Kellie Martin as Samantha "Sam" Kinsey, the owner of a British-style American bookshop which specializes in mystery novels. As is her habit, Sam ends up playing amateur detective herself, this time at a fancy health spa called Drummonds. One of the spa's customers, a woman named Debbie (Allison Smith) is found murdered, and suspicion immediately falls upon Alice (Bess Meyer), whose husband George (Scott Grimes) and Debbie were having an affair. Complicating matters is the presence of a psychic named Emily (Felicia Day) who with unbecoming eagerness offers to direct the police to the location where Debbie's body has been hidden. As a result, Emily herself is accused of the murder--and at this point Sam and her friends Cassie (Nina Siemaszko) and Philby (Clarence Williams III)--the latter a former CIA agent!--try their hand at ferreting out the real killer. Mystery Woman: Vision of Murder debuted June 5, 2005(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers 2
programme.desc: After the runaway success of Jeepers Creepers in 2001, it was inevitable there would be a sequel, but this is just as smart and scary as the original. The Creeper has just two days of his allotted 23 on earth left to both eat his fill and replenish body parts that have decayed during his enforced years of hibernation. Fortunately, a broken-down bus full of college basketball players and their cheerleaders should provide for his needs. As the students are picked off one by one, their only hope is local farmer Jack Taggart, who's out to avenge his son's death. Victor Salva's film is satisfyingly full of edge-of-the-seat moments, not to mention the required quota of gruesome deaths and gore(n)

programme.title: Breakdown
programme.desc: Jeff and Amy Taylor (Kurt Russell and Kathleen Quinlan) are travelling cross country to California. When their Jeep breaks down, she accepts a lift from trucker J T Walsh to the nearest diner to call for help. But she fails to return and when Jeff eventually gets to the diner, no-one, including the trucker, has ever seen his wife... Jonathan Mostow's taut thriller shows a man trapped in a paranoid nightmare, trying to find his wife in the face of consistent denial of her very existence(n)

programme.title: Jennifer's Body

programme.title: House on Haunted Hill
programme.desc: Re-make of a classic horror tale about a millionaire who offers a million dollars to whoever can spend a night in a spooky mansion that was once an insane asylum and location of some horrifying experiments. When a group take up his offer they are unaware that their rich benefactor has rigged the house to have some fun for his money. But he becomes very unaware that the house might really be haunted(n)

programme.title: Haunter
programme.desc: A teenage ghost teams up with a living girl to stop a phantom killer, and break a vicious supernatural cycle in this psychological horror tale from director Vincenzo Natali (Cube, Splice). Lisa Johnson (Abigail Breslin) was just one day shy of 16 when her entire family perished back in 1986. Ever since, the spirits of the young girl and her family have been trapped reliving the monotonous routine of their last day alive. Meanwhile, in the present day, young Olivia (Eleanor Zichy) moves into the Johnson's old house with her family, and bears witness to a disturbing transformation; her typically loving father is acting like a man possessed, prompting the startled teen to fear for her family's safety. Later, after failing to break through to her own family, Lisa manages to communicate with Olivia, and makes a shocking discovery: The house was once owned by a notorious serial killer who preyed on young girls (Stephen McHattie). Although dead, the madman has summoned the power to possess the living, and now dwells in the body of Olivia's father. Now, should the two girls fail to manage to stop the killer soon, the worst may be yet to come(n)

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: Stephen King's best-selling novel gets a faithful, stylish telling here from Brian De Palma, in a story of a teenage girl who discovers she has the extraordinary ability to move objects by the power of her thoughts alone, which eventually leads to mayhem and horror at her high-school prom(n)

programme.title: 28 Weeks Later
programme.desc: Six months have passed since the rage virus has annihilated the British Isles. The U.S. Army declares that the war against infection has been won, and that the reconstruction of the country can begin. As the first wave of refugees return, a family is reunited--but one of them unwittingly carries a terrible secret(n)

programme.title: Daybreakers
programme.desc: In a futuristic world overrun by vampires, a renegade bloodsucker assists the remaining human refugees. Meanwhile, vampire-run corporations try to develop a viable substitute for blood before their supply runs out(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: Die Hard 2
programme.desc: "Another basement, another elevator...how can the same thing happen to the same guy twice?" asks John McClane (Bruce Willis), in what is doubtless the key question of this film. A year after foiling the terrorist takeover of a high-rise office building in the first movie, McClane is waiting to pick up his wife, Holly (Bonnie Bedelia), at Dulles International Airport just outside Washington, D.C., on Christmas Eve. Scheduled to arrive the same evening is Ramon Esperanza (Franco Nero), a South American political figure who is being brought to the United States to stand trial for his role in a drug-smuggling ring. However, a group of terrorists, led by renegade American military officer Col. Stuart (William Sadler), take control of the airport, scuttling radio transmissions and placing their own men in the control tower. Stuart and his men ensure that Esperanza's plane lands safely, and then demand that Stuart and his men be given a fully-fueled 747 and free passage wherever they choose to go. Otherwise, they will guide the many circling jets waiting for landing instructions into definite crash landings, killing the many passengers on board. Not willing to stand aside as terrorists once again threaten his wife's life, the wise-cracking McClane once again leaps into action to foil Stuart's plans and bring the passenger jets safely to the ground. William Atherton, John Amos, Dennis Franz, and John Leguizamo highlight the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: Sports Life Stories
programme.desc: A profile of the former boxer, a four-time world super-middleweight champion considered among the elite performers in his weight class. After rising through the domestic ranks and winning both the British and Commonwealth titles, Froch claimed his first world crown by defeating Jean Pascal in 2008, and was a dominant fighter on the world scene from that point on. His legacy was assured in May 2014 when he defeated fellow Brit George Groves in a rematch at Wembley Stadium in what proved to be his final fight. That contest drew the largest attendance for a boxing bout in the UK since the Second World War at 80,000. Last in the series.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crack'd from Side to Side.
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the star's unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe

programme.desc: The surly detective tries to get out of attending a reunion of George Cross holders because a serial rapist has struck again on his patch.
